original: ci nas kyang yongs su bsngo ba'i tshe /
analyzed: ci nas kyang yongs su bsngo ba'i tshe /

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i dbang phyug tshul khrims 'dis thob par bya'o zhes mchog tu 'dzin pa med do //
translated: or the lordship of a wheel-turning king, through this morality.

original: gzhan du na tshul khrims de sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mtshan ma med pa'i yongs su bsngo ba dang / dmigs pa med pa dang / gnyis su med pa'i yongs su bsngo bas yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: gzhan du na tshul khrims de sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mtshan ma med pa'i yongs su bsngo ba dang / dmigs pa med pa dang / gnyis su med pa'i yongs su bsngo bas yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: Otherwise, he makes that morality common to all sentient beings, and dedicates it to the knowledge of all aspects, with a signless dedication, a nonapprehending dedication, and a nondual dedication.

original: de yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du /
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du /
translated: And that is in terms of worldly convention,

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: not ultimately.

original: de tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa de dang / thabs mkhas pas ro myang ba med pa'i tshul gyis bsam gtan bzhi sgrub po //
analyzed: de tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa de dang / thabs mkhas pas ro myang ba med pa'i tshul gyis bsam gtan bzhi sgrub po //
translated: With that perfection of morality fulfilled, and with skill in means, he accomplishes the four meditations without relishing them.

original: de lha'i mig mngon par sgrub ste /
analyzed: de lha'i mig mngon par sgrub ste /
translated: He accomplishes the divine eye.

original: lha'i mig rnam par smin pa @206b las byung ba des shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag thams cad mthong ste /
analyzed: lha'i mig rnam par smin pa @206b las byung ba des shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag thams cad mthong ste /
translated: With that divine eye that has arisen from the maturation of karma, he sees all the lord buddhas who are present, living, and teaching in the innumerable, countless, immeasurable world systems of the eastern direction.

original: de'i mthong ba de ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du chud za bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i mthong ba de ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du chud za bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And that vision of his will not be exhausted until he attains manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment.

original: lha'i mig rnam par smin pa las byung ba des lho dang nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs kyi phyogs re re zhing 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grang med dpag tu med pa dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang chos ston pa de dag thams cad mthong ste /
analyzed: lha'i mig rnam par smin pa las byung ba des lho dang nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs kyi phyogs re re zhing 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grang med dpag tu med pa dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang chos ston pa de dag thams cad mthong ste /
translated: With that divine eye that has arisen from the maturation of karma, he sees all the blessed buddhas who are present, live, and remain in the southern, western, northern, northeastern, southeastern, southwestern, northwestern, lower, and upper directions, in the limitless, boundless, immeasurable world systems.

original: de'i mthong ba de ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du chud za bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i mthong ba de ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du chud za bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Until he fully and completely awakens to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood, that vision will not be wasted.

original: de lha'i rna ba'i khams rnam par dag pa mi'i las 'das pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis gsungs pa'i sgra thos te /
analyzed: de lha'i rna ba'i khams rnam par dag pa mi'i las 'das pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis gsungs pa'i sgra thos te /
translated: With his divine ear, which is pure and surpasses the human, he hears the sounds of the blessed buddhas speaking.

original: de'i thos pa de yang ji srid du thos pa des bdag dang gzhan gyi don byas par ma gyur gyi bar du chud za bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i thos pa de yang ji srid du thos pa des bdag dang gzhan gyi don byas par ma gyur gyi bar du chud za bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And that hearing will not be wasted until, through that hearing, he has fulfilled his own and others‚Äô aims.

original: sems kyi rnam par shes pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi thugs sems kyis rab tu shes te /
analyzed: sems kyi rnam par shes pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi thugs sems kyis rab tu shes te /
translated: With his mind-consciousness he knows the minds of those Lord Buddhas,

original: des sems kyi rnam pa shes pa de yang ji srid du sems kyi rnam pa shes pa des sems can thams cad kyi don byas par ma gyur gyi bar du chud za bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des sems kyi rnam pa shes pa de yang ji srid du sems kyi rnam pa shes pa des sems can thams cad kyi don byas par ma gyur gyi bar du chud za bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and that knowledge of the modes of mind will not be wasted until, through that knowledge of the modes of mind, he has fulfilled the aims of all sentient beings.

original: de sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pas sems can de dag gi 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams shes shing dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis sems can de dag yang dag par ston to //üîΩyang dag par bskul lo //üîΩyang dag par gzengs bstod do //
analyzed: de sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pas sems can de dag gi 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams shes shing dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis sems can de dag yang dag par ston to // yang dag par bskul lo // yang dag par gzengs bstod do //
translated: With his knowledge of the recollection of former lives, he knows the past and future roots of virtue of those sentient beings, and with those roots of virtue he teaches those sentient beings,üîΩhe encourages them,üîΩhe inspires them,

original: yang dag par dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: yang dag par dga' bar byed do //
translated: he delights them,

original: de dag de ltar yang dag par bstan pa dang / yang dag par dga' ba'i bar du byas pa rnams kyang khyad par du 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag de ltar yang dag par bstan pa dang / yang dag par dga' ba'i bar du byas pa rnams kyang khyad par du 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: and they will be especially pleased when they are taught in that way and up to when they are gladdened in that way.

original: zag pa zad pa'i shes pas kyang sems can rnams rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu gzhog go //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa'i shes pas kyang sems can rnams rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu gzhog go //
translated: And with the knowledge of the extinction of the outflows, they will establish beings in the fruit of entering the stream,

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la rab tu gzhog go //üîΩrang @207a * //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la rab tu gzhog go // rang @207a * //
translated: in the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, in the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, and in arhatship.

original: byang chub la rab tu gzhog go //
analyzed: byang chub la rab tu gzhog go //
translated: They will establish them in individual enlightenment.

original: byang chub la rab tu gzhog go //
analyzed: byang chub la rab tu gzhog go //
translated: They will establish them in awakening.

original: de bzhin du sems can rnams dge ba'i chos gang dang gang la mthu yod pa de dang de la rab tu gzhog go //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can rnams dge ba'i chos gang dang gang la mthu yod pa de dang de la rab tu gzhog go //
translated: And similarly, they will establish beings in whatever wholesome dharmas they are able to.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: In this way, Subh≈´ti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: With a mind free from signs, they perfect the transcendent perfection of ethical discipline.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti asked,

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar mtshan ma ma mchis pa dang / dmigs su ma mchis pa dang / spob  pa med pa rnams la bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar mtshan ma ma mchis pa dang / dmigs su ma mchis pa dang / spob  pa med pa rnams la bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa lags /
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One, how do those who are free from signs, who are unobservable, and who are without confidence perfect the transcendent perfection of patience?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, here when bodhisattva great beings practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom,

original: mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: with a mind free from signs, from the first production of the thought of awakening onward,

original: snying po byang chub la 'dug gi bar du de'i drung du sems can thams cad yang dang yang 'ongs te /
analyzed: snying po byang chub la 'dug gi bar du de'i drung du sems can thams cad yang dang yang 'ongs te /
translated: all sentient beings come again and again into their presence, up until they sit at the seat of awakening.

original: rdo ba dang dbyig bas brdegs shing mtshon gyis btab kyang de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'khrugs pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa 'ga' tsam gyi go skabs kyang mi dbye'o //
analyzed: rdo ba dang dbyig bas brdegs shing mtshon gyis btab kyang de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'khrugs pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa 'ga' tsam gyi go skabs kyang mi dbye'o //
translated: Even if he is struck with stones and clods, and cut with weapons, the Bodhisattva, the great being, should not give an opportunity for a single thought of disturbance.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bzod pa gnyis bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bzod pa gnyis bsgom par bya'o //
translated: In this regard, the Bodhisattva, the great being, should cultivate two kinds of patience.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: spyo ba dang / dbyig pa dang / bong ba la sogs pas brdeg pa'i sems can rnams thams cad la bzod par bya ba gang yin pa dang / 'di'i mi skye ba'i chos rnams la bzod pa skyed bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: spyo ba dang / dbyig pa dang / bong ba la sogs pas brdeg pa'i sems can rnams thams cad la bzod par bya ba gang yin pa dang / 'di'i mi skye ba'i chos rnams la bzod pa skyed bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Patience with regard to all sentient beings who scold, beat, and strike with clods, stones, and so on; and patience that produces the acceptance of the fact that phenomena are not produced.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos spyo ba dang / mtshang 'dru ba dang / bong ba dang / dbyig pa la sogs pas brdeg pa la 'di ltar so sor brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos spyo ba dang / mtshang 'dru ba dang / bong ba dang / dbyig pa la sogs pas brdeg pa la 'di ltar so sor brtag par bya ste /
translated: In this regard, the Bodhisattva, the great being, should reflect as follows when scolded, reviled, beaten, and struck with clods, stones, and so on:

original: nga la spyo bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: nga la spyo bar byed pa'am /
translated: ‚ÄúWho scolds me?

original: mtshang 'dru bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: mtshang 'dru bar byed pa'am /
translated: Who is there to insult me?

original: bong ba dang dbyig pa dang mtshon gyis rdeg par byed pa su zhig yod ces 'di ltar so sor brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: bong ba dang dbyig pa dang mtshon gyis rdeg par byed pa su zhig yod ces 'di ltar so sor brtag par bya'o //
translated: Who is there to strike me with clods, sticks, or knives?

original: des chos rnams kyi rang bzhin la so sor brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: des chos rnams kyi rang bzhin la so sor brtag par bya ste /
translated: He should investigate the nature of phenomena in this way.

original: chos thams cad la so sor brtags pa na chos nyid kyang ma dmigs na /
analyzed: chos thams cad la so sor brtags pa na chos nyid kyang ma dmigs na /
translated: When he investigates all phenomena, he will not even apprehend their true nature.üîΩHow could there be a nature of phenomena?

original: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin lta ga la mchis zhes brtag par bya'o//
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin lta ga la mchis zhes brtag par bya'o//
translated: He should investigate in this way.

original: @207b de de ltar chos kyi rang bzhin la so sor rtog pa na 'di snyam du bdag la 'bigs pa'am gcod par byed pa su yod snyam du sems so //
analyzed: @207b de de ltar chos kyi rang bzhin la so sor rtog pa na 'di snyam du bdag la 'bigs pa'am gcod par byed pa su yod snyam du sems so //
translated: When he investigates the nature of phenomena in this way, he will think, ‚ÄúWho is there to pierce or cut me?‚Äù

original: des chos kyi rang bzhin la de ltar rtog pa na mi skye ba'i chos rnams la bzod pa rab tu thob bo //
analyzed: des chos kyi rang bzhin la de ltar rtog pa na mi skye ba'i chos rnams la bzod pa rab tu thob bo //
translated: When he investigates the nature of phenomena in this way, he will attain acceptance of phenomena that are not produced.

original: de ci'i phyir bzod pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir bzod pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called ‚Äúacceptance‚Äù?

original: nyon mongs pa mi skye ba dan ye shes mi chod pa'i phyir bzod pa ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa mi skye ba dan ye shes mi chod pa'i phyir bzod pa ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'o //
translated: Because it is the acceptance of phenomena that are not produced, because reactive emotions are not produced, and because wisdom is not destroyed.

original: de bzod pa de gnyis la gnas shing bsam gtan bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: de bzod pa de gnyis la gnas shing bsam gtan bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: Abiding in those two kinds of patience, he perfects the four meditations.

original: tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang /
translated: He perfects the four immeasurables, the four formless concentrations, the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers,

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang /
translated: the seven factors of awakening, the noble eightfold path, the three gateways to liberation, the superknowledges, the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ gateways, the ten powers of the tathƒÅgatas,

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.

original: de 'phags pa'i chos zag pa med pa /
analyzed: de 'phags pa'i chos zag pa med pa /
translated: He abides in the noble, uncontaminated dharmas,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa /
translated: the supramundane dharmas,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa de dag la gnas te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa de dag la gnas te /
translated: the dharmas that are not shared in common with any of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: 'phags pa'i mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He perfects the noble forms of superknowledge.

original: mngon par shes pa de dag yongs su rdzogs nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug yang dag par sgrub po //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa de dag yongs su rdzogs nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug yang dag par sgrub po //
translated: Having perfected the superknowledges, he accomplishes the six perfections.

original: de mngon par shes pa de la gnas te /
analyzed: de mngon par shes pa de la gnas te /
translated: Abiding in those superknowledges,

original: lha'i mig gis shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag thams cad mthong ste /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag thams cad mthong ste /
translated: he sees with his divine eye the infinite, countless, immeasurable world systems in the eastern direction, and he sees all the lord buddhas who are present there, who are alive there, and who are teaching the Dharma there.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag mthong nas sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa 'thob po //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag mthong nas sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa 'thob po //
translated: Having seen those lord buddhas, he attains the recollection of the Buddha.

original: de'i sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa de yang nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du rgyun mi 'chad do //üîΩde bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re re zhing 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med @208a * //
analyzed: de'i sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa de yang nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du rgyun mi 'chad do // de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re re zhing 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med @208a * //
translated: And that recollection of the Buddha continues uninterrupted until he fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: grangs med dpag tu med pa bdag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs pa de dag thams cad mthong ste /
analyzed: grangs med dpag tu med pa bdag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs pa de dag thams cad mthong ste /
translated: In the same way, in the southern, western, northern, northeastern, southeastern, southwestern, and northwestern directions, below and above, in each direction in countless, limitless, immeasurable world systems, he sees all the lord buddhas that are there.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag mthong nas sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa 'thob po //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag mthong nas sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa 'thob po //
translated: And having seen those lord buddhas, he attains the recollection of the Buddha.

original: de'i sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa de yang nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du rgyun mi 'chad do //
analyzed: de'i sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa de yang nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du rgyun mi 'chad do //
translated: And that recollection of the Buddha continues uninterrupted until he has attained supreme enlightenment.

original: de lha'i rna ba mi las 'das pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis gsungs pa thos te /
analyzed: de lha'i rna ba mi las 'das pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis gsungs pa thos te /
translated: With his divine ear, which is purified and surpasses the human, he hears the sounds of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, in all the ten directions.

original: thos nas kyang 'dzin to //
analyzed: thos nas kyang 'dzin to //
translated: Having heard it, he remembers it.

original: bzung nas kyang de bzhin du nan tan byed do //
analyzed: bzung nas kyang de bzhin du nan tan byed do //
translated: Having remembered it, he practices accordingly.

original: de bzhin nyid du nan tan byas nas kyang de bzhin nyid du sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du nan tan byas nas kyang de bzhin nyid du sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: Having practiced accordingly, he teaches the Dharma to beings in accordance with what he has practiced.

original: de sems kyi rnam grangs shes pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi thugs sems kyis rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de sems kyi rnam grangs shes pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi thugs sems kyis rab tu shes so //
translated: With his knowledge of the variety of mental states, he knows the minds of those Buddhas, Blessed Ones.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / sems can thams cad kyi sems kyang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / sems can thams cad kyi sems kyang rab tu shes so //
translated: He also knows the minds of all the noble disciples and pratyekabuddhas, and of all beings.

original: de sems can thams cad kyi sems sems gyis  yongs su shes par byas shing de bzhin nyid du chos ston to //
analyzed: de sems can thams cad kyi sems sems gyis  yongs su shes par byas shing de bzhin nyid du chos ston to //
translated: He teaches the Dharma to those sentient beings in accordance with reality, having understood their minds with his own mind.

original: de sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pas sems can de dag gi sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams yongs su shes par byas shing yang sems can de dag la dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par ston to //üîΩyang dag par bskul lo //
analyzed: de sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pas sems can de dag gi sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams yongs su shes par byas shing yang sems can de dag la dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par ston to // yang dag par bskul lo //
translated: ‚ÄúHe teaches the wholesome roots to those sentient beings, having understood their previous wholesome roots with his knowledge of recollecting previous states.üîΩHe encourages them.

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod do //
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod do //
translated: He inspires them.

original: yang dag par dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: yang dag par dga' bar byed do //
translated: He delights them.

original: de zag pa zad pa shes te /
analyzed: de zag pa zad pa shes te /
translated: ‚ÄúHe knows the destruction of the pollutants.

original: de zag pa zad pa shes pa des sems can rnams theg pa gsum la rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: de zag pa zad pa shes pa des sems can rnams theg pa gsum la rab tu 'god do //
translated: With that knowledge of the destruction of the pollutants, he establishes sentient beings in the three vehicles.

original: rab tu 'jog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu 'jog par 'gyur ro //
translated: He causes them to be established.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: That bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom with skillful means brings sentient beings to maturity.‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
translated: they purify a buddhafield;

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byas te /
translated: they complete the knowledge of all modes;

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgya'o //
translated: they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment;

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
translated: having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, they turn the wheel of the Dharma;

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas sems can rnams theg pa gsum gyis 'khor ba las yongs su 'grel to //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas sems can rnams theg pa gsum gyis 'khor ba las yongs su 'grel to //
translated: having turned the wheel of the Dharma, they liberate beings from the three realms of existence by means of the three vehicles.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol @208b tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol @208b tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: In this way, Subh≈´ti, do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

analyzed: mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin no //

analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: ‚ÄúSu¬≠bh≈´ti, this is how bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /

analyzed: de lus kyi brtson 'grus la gnas nas /

analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //

analyzed: des bsam gtan bzhi pa la mnyam par gzhag cing /
translated: He enters into the fourth concentration and

analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba'i bar du lag pas byugs shing tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du lus kyis dbang bsgyur te /

original: de lus kyi brtson 'grus de lta bu dang ldan pas rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam pa des phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang chos ston pa
analyzed: de lus kyi brtson 'grus de lta bu dang ldan pas rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam pa des phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang chos ston pa
translated: Endowed with such physical diligence, by means of that miraculous power he goes to the innumerable, countless, immeasurable world systems in the ten directions, where he attends upon and makes offerings to the blessed buddhas,

original: de dag tu song zhing sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la na bza' dang / bsod snyoms dang / gzims cha dang / snyun gyi rkyen sman dang / yo byad mang pos bsnyen bkur byed de /

translated: Having gone there, they will serve those Buddha Bhagavats with robes, alms-food, beds and seats, and with medicinal decoctions for curing the sick.

original: na bza' dang / bsod snyoms dang / gzims cha dang / snyun gyi rkyen sman dang / yo byad mang po de dag kyang nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du zad par mi 'gyur te /üîΩbyang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang gos dang / bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang / nad kyi rkyen rtsi dang / yo byad mang pos lha dang / mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig @209a * //
analyzed: na bza' dang / bsod snyoms dang / gzims cha dang / snyun gyi rkyen sman dang / yo byad mang po de dag kyang nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du zad par mi 'gyur te / byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang gos dang / bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang / nad kyi rkyen rtsi dang / yo byad mang pos lha dang / mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig @209a * //
translated: Those robes, alms-food, beds and seats, and medicinal decoctions for curing the sick will not be exhausted until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: rten bde bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rten bde bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood, they will bring happiness to the world with its gods, humans, and asuras with the gifts of robes, alms-food, beds and seats, and medicinal decoctions for curing the sick.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang ring bsrel la ring bsrel gyi mchod pa mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang ring bsrel la ring bsrel gyi mchod pa mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and even after his parinirvƒÅ·πáa, there will be many worshipful offerings to his relics.

original: rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba de nyid kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi drung du song zhing chos nyan te /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba de nyid kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi drung du song zhing chos nyan te /
translated: By means of that very magical creation he goes into the presence of those Lord Buddhas and hears the Dharma.

original: ji skad du thos pa de yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du nam yang chud za bar mi 'gyur ro //üîΩrnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la spyod cing sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed /
analyzed: ji skad du thos pa de yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du nam yang chud za bar mi 'gyur ro // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la spyod cing sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed /
translated: And he never loses that Dharma, until he attains the knowledge of all modes.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: He also brings beings to maturity and purifies the Buddha-field.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhuti : In that way, then, does the Bodhisattva, the great being, coursing in the perfection of wisdom,

original: chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / dmigs su med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la lus kyi brtson 'grus dang ldan pas brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / dmigs su med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la lus kyi brtson 'grus dang ldan pas brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: They perfect the perfection of perseverance by means of physical perseverance in all dharmas that are signless, have no wish for anything, are unattainable, do not come, and are not born.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos ci ltar sems kyi brtson 'grus 'phags pa zag pa med pa lam gyi yan lag gi khongs su gtogs pa dang ldan pas brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos ci ltar sems kyi brtson 'grus 'phags pa zag pa med pa lam gyi yan lag gi khongs su gtogs pa dang ldan pas brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, how do bodhisattva great beings, endowed with mental perseverance in dharmas that are noble, uncontaminated, and included among the limbs of the path, perfect the perfection of perseverance?

translated: ‚Äúsupramundane,‚ÄùüîΩ‚Äúafflicted‚Äù or

original: nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya ba'am /üîΩkha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'am /üîΩkha na ma tho ba med pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya ba'am / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'am / kha na ma tho ba med pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: ‚Äúunafflicted,‚Äù

original: zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'am /üîΩzag pa med pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'am / zag pa med pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: ‚Äúblameworthy‚Äù orüîΩ‚Äúblameless,‚Äù

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: ‚Äúdefiled‚Äù orüîΩ‚Äúundefiled,‚Äù

original: rnam par byang ba zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba zhes bya ba'am /
translated: ‚Äúentangled‚Äù orüîΩ‚Äúunentangled,‚Äù

original: 'dus byas zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'dus byas zhes bya ba'am /
translated: ‚Äúconditioned‚Äù or

original: 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba snyoms pa med do //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba snyoms pa med do //
translated: ‚Äúunconditioned,‚ÄùüîΩ‚Äústream enterer‚Äù or

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu snyems pa med do //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu snyems pa med do //
translated: ‚Äústream enterer‚Äôs result,‚Äù

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / byang chub sems dpa' nyid dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu snyoms pa med do //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / byang chub sems dpa' nyid dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu snyoms pa med do //
translated: the stage of a bodhisattva, and unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.üîΩThey do not become conceited thinking, ‚ÄòI am a stream enterer,‚Äô ‚ÄòI am a once-returner,‚Äô ‚ÄòI am a non-returner,‚Äô ‚ÄòI am an arhat,‚Äô

original: rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya ba dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba zhes bya ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya ba dang / dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba dang / rang sangs rgyas zhes bya ba dang / @210a * //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya ba dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba zhes bya ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya ba dang / dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba dang / rang sangs rgyas zhes bya ba dang / @210a * //
translated: ‚ÄòI am a pratyekabuddha,‚Äô

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / sangs rgyas zhes bya bar snyems pa med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / sangs rgyas zhes bya bar snyems pa med do //
translated: ‚ÄòI am a bodhisattva,‚Äô or ‚ÄòI am a buddha.‚Äô

original: sems can de dag ni mthong ba'i lam gyis rab tu phye ba /üîΩ'di dag ni bsrabs pa'i sas rab tu phye ba /
analyzed: sems can de dag ni mthong ba'i lam gyis rab tu phye ba / 'di dag ni bsrabs pa'i sas rab tu phye ba /
translated: Those sentient beings are distinguished by the path of seeing.üîΩThey are distinguished by the stage of thinning.

original: 'di dag ni 'og ma'i cha dang mthun pas rab tu phye ba /
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'og ma'i cha dang mthun pas rab tu phye ba /
translated: They are distinguished by the stage that is compatible with the lower.

original: 'di dag ni gong ma'i cha dang mthun pas rab tu phye ba /
analyzed: 'di dag ni gong ma'i cha dang mthun pas rab tu phye ba /
translated: They are distinguished by being in accord with the higher stages.

original: 'di dag ni rang sangs rgyas nyid kyis rab tu brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di dag ni rang sangs rgyas nyid kyis rab tu brjod pa /
translated: They are distinguished by being pratyekabuddhas.

original: 'di dag ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyis rab tu brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di dag ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyis rab tu brjod pa /
translated: They are distinguished by being the knowledge of the aspects of the path.

original: 'di dag ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis rab tu brjod pa zhes bya bar snyoms pa med do //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis rab tu brjod pa zhes bya bar snyoms pa med do //
translated: They are distinguished by being the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩAnd why?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩde ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni 'di ltar /
translated: Because

original: de dag la ngo bo nyid gang gis rab tu dbye bar bya ba de dag gi ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: de dag la ngo bo nyid gang gis rab tu dbye bar bya ba de dag gi ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: those things that are to be distinguished do not have an intrinsic nature.

original: de sems las byung ba'i brtson 'grus de lta bu dang ldan pas mngon du gyur kyang sems can de dag kyang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de sems las byung ba'i brtson 'grus de lta bu dang ldan pas mngon du gyur kyang sems can de dag kyang mi dmigs so //
translated: Endowed with such an effort that arises from the mind, he does not even apprehend those sentient beings, even though they are manifest.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang yongs su rdzogs par byed /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang yongs su rdzogs par byed /
translated: He perfects the perfection of effort.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de yang mi dmigs so //
translated: And he does not even apprehend that perfection of effort.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: He perfects the buddhadharmas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag kyang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag kyang mi dmigs so //
translated: and he does not apprehend those qualities of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: He perfects a buddhafield,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de yang mi dmigs so //
translated: and he does not apprehend that buddhafield.

original: de sems kyi brtson 'grus de lta bu dang ldan pas dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su 'dzin kyang de la chags pa med de /
analyzed: de sems kyi brtson 'grus de lta bu dang ldan pas dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su 'dzin kyang de la chags pa med de /
translated: Endowed with such mental perseverance, he acquires all wholesome states, and he is not attached to them.

original: de chags pa med par sems can rnams kyi don byed cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro /
analyzed: de chags pa med par sems can rnams kyi don byed cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro /
translated: Without attachment, he works for the welfare of sentient beings, and he goes from buddhafield to buddhafield.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams nas 'jig rten gyi khams su 'gro zhing sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams nas 'jig rten gyi khams su 'gro zhing sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
translated: He goes from world system to world system, and he works for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams kyi don byed pa na rdzu 'phrul dang cho 'phrul gang dang gang gis rnam par 'phrul pa 'dod pa'i rdzu 'phrul de dang cho 'phrul de dang des rnam par 'phrul te /üîΩme tog gi char dbab pa'am /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don byed pa na rdzu 'phrul dang cho 'phrul gang dang gang gis rnam par 'phrul pa 'dod pa'i rdzu 'phrul de dang cho 'phrul de dang des rnam par 'phrul te / me tog gi char dbab pa'am /
translated: When he works for the welfare of sentient beings, he manifests whatever miracles and marvelous abilities he wishes to manifest.üîΩHe manifests a rain of flowers,

original: spos kyi ngad 'gyed pa'am /
analyzed: spos kyi ngad 'gyed pa'am /
translated: or the fragrance of incense,

original: 'brug gi sgra bsgrags pa'am /
analyzed: 'brug gi sgra bsgrags pa'am /
translated: the sound of thunder,

original: glu bro dang sil snyan gyi sgra bsgrags pa'am /
analyzed: glu bro dang sil snyan gyi sgra bsgrags pa'am /
translated: the sound of songs and musical instruments,

original: sa bskyod pa'am ;
analyzed: sa bskyod pa'am ;
translated: earth-shaking,

original: snang ba bstan pa'am /
analyzed: snang ba bstan pa'am /
translated: the display of light,

original: rin po che sna bdun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams bstan pa rnam par 'phrul te /
analyzed: rin po che sna bdun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams bstan pa rnam par 'phrul te /
translated: or the display of a world system made of the seven precious substances.

original: gang dang gang du gang sems can rnams kyi don du 'gyur ba de dag kyang bdag gi lus las 'gyed de /
analyzed: gang dang gang du gang sems can rnams kyi don du 'gyur ba de dag kyang bdag gi lus las 'gyed de /
translated: I emanate from my own body whatever will benefit sentient beings in whatever way is necessary.

original: sems can rnams kyi don du bar 'ga' bdag 'gyed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don du bar 'ga' bdag 'gyed do //
translated: For the sake of sentient beings, I sometimes emanate as a man,

original: bar 'ga' dri zhim @210b por 'gyed do //
analyzed: bar 'ga' dri zhim @210b por 'gyed do //
translated: sometimes as a woman,

original: bar 'ga' srog gcod pa med pa'i mchod sbyin chen po byed do //üîΩbar 'ga' sems can mtha' yas pa lam ma yin pa nas 'don te /üîΩsrog gcod pa las ldog go //
analyzed: bar 'ga' srog gcod pa med pa'i mchod sbyin chen po byed do // bar 'ga' sems can mtha' yas pa lam ma yin pa nas 'don te / srog gcod pa las ldog go //
translated: sometimes as a great sacrifice that is free from killing,üîΩsometimes as a great sacrifice that is free from stealing,üîΩsometimes as a great sacrifice that is free from sexual misconduct,üîΩsometimes as a great sacrifice that is free from lying,üîΩsometimes as a great sacrifice that is free from slander,

original: ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / phra ma smra ba'am /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / phra ma smra ba'am /
translated: sometimes as a great sacrifice that is free from harsh speech,üîΩand sometimes as a great sacrifice that is free from idle talk.

original: zhe gcod pa'i tshig dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / tshig kyal pa dang / chags sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba las yongs su 'grel to //
analyzed: zhe gcod pa'i tshig dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / tshig kyal pa dang / chags sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba las yongs su 'grel to //
translated: He delivers them from harsh speech, lying, idle talk, covetousness, malice, and wrong views.

original: la la la ni sbyin pas phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: la la la ni sbyin pas phan 'dogs so //
translated: To some he helps with generosity.

original: la la la ni tshul khrims kyis phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: la la la ni tshul khrims kyis phan 'dogs so //
translated: To some he helps with morality.

original: la la'i don du ni yan lag dang nyid lag yongs su gtong ngo//
analyzed: la la'i don du ni yan lag dang nyid lag yongs su gtong ngo//
translated: For the sake of some he gives up his limbs and major parts.

original: la la'i don du ni bu dang chung ma yongs su gtong ngo //
analyzed: la la'i don du ni bu dang chung ma yongs su gtong ngo //
translated: For the sake of some he gives up his children and wife.

original: la la'i don du ni rgyal srid yongs su gtong ngo //
analyzed: la la'i don du ni rgyal srid yongs su gtong ngo //
translated: For the sake of some he gives up his kingdom.

original: la la'i don du ni bdag kyang yongs su gtong ngo //
analyzed: la la'i don du ni bdag kyang yongs su gtong ngo //
translated: For the sake of some he gives up himself.

original: de ltar thabs gang dang gang gis sems can rnams kyi don du 'gyur ba'i thabs de dang des sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
analyzed: de ltar thabs gang dang gang gis sems can rnams kyi don du 'gyur ba'i thabs de dang des sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
translated: In this way, for the sake of sentient beings, he helps sentient beings with whatever means is appropriate.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subh≈´ti, in this way, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang / sems kyi brtson 'grus dang ldan pas brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang / sems kyi brtson 'grus dang ldan pas brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: and all phenomena are signless, he perfects the perfection of perseverance through the perseverance of mind.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One, how do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: mtshan ma med pa'i chos rnams la gnas nas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i chos rnams la gnas nas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa lags /
translated: perfect the perfection of concentration by abiding in signless phenomena?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ma gtogs par ting nge 'dzin gzhan thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ma gtogs par ting nge 'dzin gzhan thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: perfect all concentrations except for the thus-gone concentration.

original: de 'dod pas dben pa /
analyzed: de 'dod pas dben pa /
translated: They are free from desire

original: sdig to mi dge ba'i chos kyis dben pa /
analyzed: sdig to mi dge ba'i chos kyis dben pa /
translated: He is free from evil, unwholesome dharmas,

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa /üîΩdpyod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa / dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
translated: he has applied thought and reflection,

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: and he dwells having attained the first concentration which is born of solitude and is accompanied by applied and sustained thought and is filled with rapture and joy.üîΩHe dwells having attained the second concentration which is born of concentration of mind and is filled with rapture and joy, and is without applied and sustained thought, and is filled with mental one-pointedness and confidence born of concentration.üîΩHe dwells having attained the third concentration which is free from rapture, and is filled with mental and physical bliss, and is without applied and sustained thought, and is filled with mental one-pointedness.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He dwells having attained the fourth concentration which is free from both pain and pleasure, and is filled with complete purity of mental one-pointedness and equanimity.

original: de byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems dang / snying rje @211a * //üîΩdang ldan pa'i sems dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa'i sems dang / btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i sems kyis 'jig rten gyi chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa /
analyzed: de byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems dang / snying rje @211a * // dang ldan pa'i sems dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa'i sems dang / btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i sems kyis 'jig rten gyi chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa /
translated: He dwells having filled and completely fulfilled with his mind endowed with loving-kindness the whole of the eastern direction,üîΩand likewise the southern, the western, the northern, the downward, the upward, the four intermediate directions, and above and below, all together, the whole world system, with his mind endowed with loving-kindness.

original: nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa thams cad rnam pa thams cad du rgyas par bkang zhing nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa thams cad rnam pa thams cad du rgyas par bkang zhing nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He dwells having filled and completely fulfilled with his mind endowed with compassion, with his mind endowed with joy, and with his mind endowed with equanimity the whole world system, all together, above and below, and in all directions.

original: de nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: de nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He dwells having attained the sphere of infinite space, the sphere of infinite consciousness, the sphere of nothingness, and the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: de bsam gtan gyi ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la gnas shing rnam par thar ba brgyad la lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs dang mi mthun par snyoms par 'jug cing rnam par ldang ngo //
analyzed: de bsam gtan gyi ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la gnas shing rnam par thar ba brgyad la lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs dang mi mthun par snyoms par 'jug cing rnam par ldang ngo //
translated: Dwelling in this perfection of meditative stabilization of the meditative stabilizations, he enters into and arises from the eight liberations in forward and reverse order.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He dwells having attained the nine serial absorptions, the meditative stabilization of emptiness, the meditative stabilization of wishlessness, and the meditative stabilization of signlessness.

original: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He dwells having attained the meditative stabilization without discrimination and the meditative stabilization of cessation.

original: glog lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: glog lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He abides in the meditative stabilization that is like a lightning bolt, the correct meditative stabilization, and the vajra-like meditative stabilization.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He abides in the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.üîΩAbiding in this perfection of meditative stabilization, with the knowledge of the aspect of the path he includes all meditative stabilizations within the knowledge of the aspect of the path.

original: de ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la gnas nas lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis lam gyi rnam par shes pa nyid kyi khongs su ting nge 'dzin thams cad chud par byas shing dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa
analyzed: de ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la gnas nas lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis lam gyi rnam par shes pa nyid kyi khongs su ting nge 'dzin thams cad chud par byas shing dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa
translated: He passes beyond the stage of bright vision,

original: las 'da'o // dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa las 'das nas rigs kyi sa dang / brgyad pa'i sa dang / mthong ba'i sa dang / bsrabs pa'i sa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa dang / byas pa rtogs pa'i sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'da'o //
analyzed: las 'da'o // dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa las 'das nas rigs kyi sa dang / brgyad pa'i sa dang / mthong ba'i sa dang / bsrabs pa'i sa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa dang / byas pa rtogs pa'i sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'da'o //
translated: passes beyond the stage of bright vision, passes beyond the lineage stage, the eighth stage, the seeing stage, the thinning stage, the detached stage, the stage of one who has done what was to be done, and the pratyekabuddha stage.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug go //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug go //
translated: Having transcended the level of the pratyekabuddhas, they enter into the secure state of the bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs nas sangs rgyas kyis yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs nas sangs rgyas kyis yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: Having entered into the secure state of the bodhisattvas, they perfect the powers of the Buddhas.

original: des de dag la spyod cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes ma thob kyi bar du 'bras bu bar ma dor thob par mi byed de /
analyzed: des de dag la spyod cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes ma thob kyi bar du 'bras bu bar ma dor thob par mi byed de /
translated: Practicing those, they do not take an intermediate attainment until they have attained the knowledge of a knower of all aspects.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la gnas shing mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byas nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams @211b la bsnyen bkur byed cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la gnas shing mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byas nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams @211b la bsnyen bkur byed cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ste /
translated: Dwelling in this perfection of meditative stabilization, having perfected the superknowledges, they serve the lord buddhas and go from buddhafield to buddhafield.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la bsnyen bkur byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la bsnyen bkur byed do //
translated: They serve those lord buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la yang dge ba'i rtsa ba gang gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par 'gyur ba dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed par byed de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la yang dge ba'i rtsa ba gang gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par 'gyur ba dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed par byed de /
translated: He plants wholesome roots in the presence of those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, by which wholesome roots the Buddha-field will be purified and beings will be matured.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams nas 'jig rten gyi khams su 'gro zhing sems can rnams kyi don byed de /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams nas 'jig rten gyi khams su 'gro zhing sems can rnams kyi don byed de /
translated: He goes from world system to world system, working for the welfare of beings.

original: de la sems can la la ni sbyin pas yongs su sdud do //
analyzed: de la sems can la la ni sbyin pas yongs su sdud do //
translated: He attracts some beings with generosity.

original: la la ni tshul khrims kyis yongs su sdud do //üîΩla la ni bzod pas yongs su sdud do //
analyzed: la la ni tshul khrims kyis yongs su sdud do // la la ni bzod pas yongs su sdud do //
translated: He attracts some with morality.üîΩHe attracts some with forbearance.

original: la la ni brtson 'grus kyis yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: la la ni brtson 'grus kyis yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: He attracts some with striving.

original: la la ni ting nge 'dzin gyis yongs su sdud do //
analyzed: la la ni ting nge 'dzin gyis yongs su sdud do //
translated: He attracts some with meditation.

original: la la ni shes rab kyis yongs su sdud do //
analyzed: la la ni shes rab kyis yongs su sdud do //
translated: He attracts some with wisdom.

original: la la ni rnam par grol bas yongs su sdud do //
analyzed: la la ni rnam par grol bas yongs su sdud do //
translated: He attracts some with liberation.

original: la la ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong bas yongs su sdud do //
analyzed: la la ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong bas yongs su sdud do //
translated: He attracts some with the vision of the knowledge of liberation.

original: la la ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu gzhog go //
analyzed: la la ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu gzhog go //
translated: some he establishes in the fruit of entering the stream,

original: la la ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la rab tu gzhog go //
analyzed: la la ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la rab tu gzhog go //
translated: some in the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, some in the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, some in arhatship,

original: la la ni rang byang chub la rab tu gzhog go //
analyzed: la la ni rang byang chub la rab tu gzhog go //
translated: some in individual enlightenment,

original: la la ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu gzhog go //
analyzed: la la ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu gzhog go //
translated: and some in supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: de de ltar dge ba'i chos gang dang gang gis sems can rnams mthong bar 'gyur ba de dang de la sbyor te /
analyzed: de de ltar dge ba'i chos gang dang gang gis sems can rnams mthong bar 'gyur ba de dang de la sbyor te /
translated: In whatever wholesome dharmas he sees beings to be established, in those he establishes them.

original: de ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la gnas shing gzungs kyi sgo thams cad mngon par sgrub po //
analyzed: de ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la gnas shing gzungs kyi sgo thams cad mngon par sgrub po //
translated: ‚ÄúStanding in that perfection of meditative stabilization, he accomplishes all the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ gateways

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi rab tu thob bo //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi rab tu thob bo //
translated: and attains the four detailed and thorough knowledges.

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa rnams kyang thob pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa rnams kyang thob pa yin te /
translated: He also attains the clairvoyances that arise from the ripening of karma.

original: de nam yang las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis ma'i mngal du skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nam yang las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis ma'i mngal du skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will never again be born from a womb due to karma and afflictions.

original: nam yang 'dod pa la brten par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam yang 'dod pa la brten par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will never again rely on desire.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du skye ba yongs su mi 'dzin pa'ang gang yang med do //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du skye ba yongs su mi 'dzin pa'ang gang yang med do //
translated: There is nothing that they will not take up in order to ripen beings.

original: skye ba'i nyes pas kyang gos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i nyes pas kyang gos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not be tainted by the faults of birth.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩde ni 'di ltar des sgyu ma lta bu'i chos thams cad rab tu mthong rab tu rig rab tu rtogs pas na de sgyu ma lta bu'i 'du byed thams cad rig par byas shing snying rje chen pos yongs su bzung ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni 'di ltar des sgyu ma lta bu'i chos thams cad rab tu mthong rab tu rig rab tu rtogs pas na de sgyu ma lta bu'i 'du byed thams cad rig par byas shing snying rje chen pos yongs su bzung ste /
translated: Why is this?

original: sems can thams cad kyi don byed do //üîΩde la yang sems can nam sems can @212a * //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don byed do // de la yang sems can nam sems can @212a * //
translated: Because they see all phenomena as illusions, they understand them, and they realize them. They understand all illusory formations and, through great compassion, they work for the welfare of all beings.

original: du gdags pa dmigs su med do //
analyzed: du gdags pa dmigs su med do //
translated: But there are no beings or designations of beings to be found there.

original: des chos thams cad mi dmigs nas 'jig rten gyi tha snyad nye bar bzung ste dmigs su med pa de nyid la sems can rnams 'god de /
analyzed: des chos thams cad mi dmigs nas 'jig rten gyi tha snyad nye bar bzung ste dmigs su med pa de nyid la sems can rnams 'god de /
translated: Having not observed any phenomena, he or she establishes sentient beings in the very non-observation, taking up mundane conventions,

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in the ultimate.

original: de ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la gnas shing bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad la spyod de /
analyzed: de ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la gnas shing bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad la spyod de /
translated: Abiding in this perfection of meditative stabilization, he or she practices all the meditative stabilizations, liberations, concentrations, and absorptions.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du nam yang ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du nam yang ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Until he or she fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, he or she will never be separated from the perfection of meditative stabilization.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag la gnas shing lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par bsgrubs te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag la gnas shing lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par bsgrubs te /
translated: Abiding in these perfections of meditative stabilization, he or she actualizes the knowledge of path aspects and the understanding of all aspects.

original: de la gnas nas bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: de la gnas nas bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad rab tu spong ngo //
translated: Standing in that, they completely abandon all the afflictions that connect to latent tendencies.

original: de la gnas shing bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad rab tu spangs nas /
analyzed: de la gnas shing bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad rab tu spangs nas /
translated: Standing in that, having completely abandoned all the afflictions that connect to latent tendencies,

original: bdag gi don kyang byed /
analyzed: bdag gi don kyang byed /
translated: they accomplish their own goal

original: gzhan gyi don kyang byed /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don kyang byed /
translated: and they accomplish the goals of others.

original: des bdag dang gzhan gyi don byas nas lha dang / mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi rim gro'i gnas su gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: des bdag dang gzhan gyi don byas nas lha dang / mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi rim gro'i gnas su gyur pa yin te /
translated: Having accomplished their own and others‚Äô goals, they become objects of worship in the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subh≈´ti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom like that

original: chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang / mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa gang yang rung bar zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad skad cig ma gcig gis bsdus pa'i mtshan nyid
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang / mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa gang yang rung bar zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad skad cig ma gcig gis bsdus pa'i mtshan nyid
translated: The perfection of the mind‚Äôs meditative absorption that is devoid of signs and free from signs is perfected.

original: can gyi sems kyi skad cig ma gcig pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ste dang po'o /
analyzed: can gyi sems kyi skad cig ma gcig pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ste dang po'o /
translated: This is the first clear realization of the mind‚Äôs single instant, which has the characteristic of all uncontaminated phenomena being included in a single instant of any of the perfections, such as generosity.

original: // / rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: // / rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One, how is it that when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: mtshan ma med pa'i chos rnams la gnas nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i chos rnams la gnas nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba lags /
translated: they complete the perfection of wisdom by abiding in signless phenomena?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,üîΩ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,üîΩthey do not see the perfection of wisdom, nor do they see someone practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subh≈´ti, here when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: yang dag pa'am yongs su grub pa'i chos gang yang yang dag par rjes su mthong ba med @212b de ;
analyzed: yang dag pa'am yongs su grub pa'i chos gang yang yang dag par rjes su mthong ba med @212b de ;
translated: they do not see any real or fully present phenomenon.

original: gzugs kyi yang dag pa dang yongs su grub pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs kyi yang dag pa dang yongs su grub pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see the reality or full presence of form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i yang dag pa dang / yongs su grub pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i yang dag pa dang / yongs su grub pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see the reality or full presence of feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: de de ltar rtogs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de de ltar rtogs pa'i tshe /
translated: When they understand in that way,

original: gzugs kyi rang bzhin mi dmigs so ;
analyzed: gzugs kyi rang bzhin mi dmigs so ;
translated: they do not apprehend the intrinsic nature of form.

original: / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs so //
analyzed: / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs so //
translated: They do not apprehend the intrinsic nature of feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi rang bzhin mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi rang bzhin mi dmigs so //
translated: They do not apprehend the intrinsic nature of¬†.¬†.¬†. up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyi pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyi pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When they practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs par byed de /
translated: they realize that all phenomena are by nature nonexistent.

original: de de ltar rtogs par byed cing nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / phyi stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de de ltar rtogs par byed cing nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / phyi stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When they practice like that and practice inner emptiness, practice outer emptiness, practice inner and outer emptiness, up to and practice the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,

original: gzugs sam / tshor ba'am /üîΩ'du shes sam /
analyzed: gzugs sam / tshor ba'am / 'du shes sam /
translated: they do not settle down on form,üîΩthey do not settle down on feeling,

original: 'du byed dam /
analyzed: 'du byed dam /
translated: they do not settle down on perception,üîΩthey do not settle down on volitional factors,

analyzed: rnam par shes pa'am / skye mched dam /
translated: they do not settle down on consciousness,üîΩthey do not settle down on the sense fields,üîΩthey do not settle down on the elements,

analyzed: stong pa nyid thams cad dam /

analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams sam /

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams sam /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams sam /

original: bsam gtan rnams sam /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams sam /
translated: they do not settle down on the concentrations,

original: tshad med pa rnams sam /
analyzed: tshad med pa rnams sam /
translated: they do not settle down on the immeasurables,

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams sam /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams sam /
translated: they do not settle down on the formless absorptions,

original: rnam par thar pa rnams sam /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa rnams sam /

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams sam /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams sam /

analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams sam /

analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams sam /

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams sam /

analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams sam /
translated: the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ gateways,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams sam /

analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams sam /

analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams sam / byams pa chen po'am /
translated: the detailed and thorough knowledges,üîΩgreat love,

original: snying rje chen po'am /
analyzed: snying rje chen po'am /
translated: great compassion,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams sam /üîΩbla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar ram /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams sam / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar ram /

analyzed: chos gang la yang mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: or up to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, or to any dharma at all.

original: de dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: ‚ÄúHe practices the perfection of wisdom with the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,

original: byang chub kyi lam yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: and he perfects the path to enlightenment.

original: 'di ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams @213a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams @213a * //
translated: In this way they perfect the six perfections, all the emptinesses, the thirty-seven factors for awakening, the noble truths, the meditative stabilizations,

analyzed: dang ; tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang /
translated: the immeasurable aspirations, the formless meditative stabilizations, the liberations, the serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness,

original: mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang /
translated: the superknowledges, the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ gateways, the powers of the tathƒÅgatas, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion,

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
