analyzed: skyes bu mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: He also possesses the thirty-two marks and eighty signs of a great being.

original: de byang chub sems dpa'i lam rnam par smin pa'i chos can la gnas pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug po yongs su rdzogs pa dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yongs su rdzogs pa dang /
analyzed: de byang chub sems dpa'i lam rnam par smin pa'i chos can la gnas pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug po yongs su rdzogs pa dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yongs su rdzogs pa dang /
translated: The bodhisattva who is on the stage of maturation of the bodhisattva path, having perfected the six perfections, having perfected all the emptinesses and the thirty-seven factors of awakening,

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa lnga'i bar du yongs su rdzogs par gyur nas sems can gang la sbyin pas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la yang sbyin pas phan 'dogs so //üîΩgang la tshul khrims kyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la yang tshul khrims kyis phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa lnga'i bar du yongs su rdzogs par gyur nas sems can gang la sbyin pas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la yang sbyin pas phan 'dogs so // gang la tshul khrims kyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la yang tshul khrims kyis phan 'dogs so //
translated: having perfected up to the five superknowledges that arise from maturation, benefits with giving those beings who are to be benefited with giving.üîΩHe benefits with morality those who are to be benefited with morality.

original: gang la bzod pas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la yang bzod pas phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: gang la bzod pas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la yang bzod pas phan 'dogs so //
translated: He benefits with patience those who are to be benefited with patience.

original: gang la brtson 'grus kyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la yang brtson 'grus kyis phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: gang la brtson 'grus kyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la yang brtson 'grus kyis phan 'dogs so //
translated: He helps those who should be helped by means of energy.

original: gang la ting nge 'dzin gyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la yang ting nge 'dzin gyis phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: gang la ting nge 'dzin gyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la yang ting nge 'dzin gyis phan 'dogs so //
translated: He helps those who should be helped by means of concentration.

original: gang la shes rab kyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la yang shes rab kyis phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: gang la shes rab kyis phan gdags par bya ba de dag la yang shes rab kyis phan 'dogs so //
translated: He helps those who should be helped by means of wisdom.

original: gang la rnam par grol bas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la yang rnam par grol bas phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: gang la rnam par grol bas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la yang rnam par grol bas phan 'dogs so //
translated: He helps those who should be helped by means of liberation.

original: gang la rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong bas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la yang rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong bas phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: gang la rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong bas phan gdags par bya ba de dag la yang rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong bas phan 'dogs so //
translated: He helps those who should be helped by means of the vision of the wisdom of liberation.

original: gang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'god par bya ba de dag kyang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: gang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'god par bya ba de dag kyang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu 'god do //
translated: He establishes those who should be established in the fruit of entering the stream in the fruit of entering the stream.

original: gang lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i @213b 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu 'god par bya ba de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: gang lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i @213b 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu 'god par bya ba de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu 'god do //
translated: those who are established in the result of once-returner, in the result of non-returner, in the state of a worthy one, in a pratyekabuddha‚Äôs awakening, and in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, they too are established in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de bzhin du rgyas par sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩde rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam pa du mas rnam par 'phrul zhing 'jig rten gyi khams gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du 'gro ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyas par sbyar bar bya'o // de rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam pa du mas rnam par 'phrul zhing 'jig rten gyi khams gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du 'gro ste /
translated: In the same way, it should be expanded.üîΩWith many kinds of miracles he goes to as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Ganges River.

original: de 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed po de dag rin po che gang las 'dod pa'i rin po che de dag las grub par mngon par sgrub ste /
analyzed: de 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed po de dag rin po che gang las 'dod pa'i rin po che de dag las grub par mngon par sgrub ste /
translated: If he wishes, he establishes those many world systems as many as there are sand particles in the Ganges River in a single atom.

original: de sems can rnams kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed cing 'jig rten gyi khams nas 'jig rten gyi khams su 'gro ste /
analyzed: de sems can rnams kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed cing 'jig rten gyi khams nas 'jig rten gyi khams su 'gro ste /
translated: It fulfills the wishes of sentient beings and goes from world system to world system.

original: des 'jig rten gyi khams de dag mthong nas ci 'dod par sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su 'dzin te /
analyzed: des 'jig rten gyi khams de dag mthong nas ci 'dod par sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su 'dzin te /
translated: Having seen those world systems, it takes possession of a buddha-field as it wishes.

original: 'di ltar dper na /
analyzed: 'di ltar dper na /
translated: For example,

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i ris kyi longs spyod dang / skyid pa lta bu dag dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan btsal ba dang bral ba dag na longs spyod dang skyid pa gang ji snyed pa de dag der 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i ris kyi longs spyod dang / skyid pa lta bu dag dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan btsal ba dang bral ba dag na longs spyod dang skyid pa gang ji snyed pa de dag der 'byung ste /
translated: it is like the enjoyments and happiness of the gods of the Paranirmitava≈õavartin class, and whatever enjoyments and happiness there are in other buddha-fields that are free from searching, they all appear there.

original: de rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: de rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: That is the perfection of giving, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom that has arisen from the maturation of karma.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa rnams dang / rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i byang chub kyi lam des lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod cing chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa thob nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa rnams dang / rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i byang chub kyi lam des lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod cing chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa thob nas /
translated: and the perfection of wisdom, and the superknowledges that arise from evolution, and the path to enlightenment that arises from evolution, and with that path he practices the knowledge of path aspects and attains the perfection of all dharmas,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob ste /
translated: and then he attains the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gal te ji tsam du gzugs yongs su gzung ba med pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su gzung ba med pa dang / skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yongs su gzung ba med pa dang ;
analyzed: gal te ji tsam du gzugs yongs su gzung ba med pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su gzung ba med pa dang / skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yongs su gzung ba med pa dang ;
translated: If form is ungraspable, and feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness are ungraspable, and the sense fields, elements, and dependent origination are ungraspable,

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams yongs su gzung ba med pa de bzhin du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par @214a * //
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams yongs su gzung ba med pa de bzhin du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par @214a * //
translated: and unconditioned phenomena, in the same way, they do not apprehend wholesome and unwholesome phenomena, mundane and supramundane phenomena, contaminated and uncontaminated phenomena, conditioned and unconditioned phenomena, and they do not apprehend the nonapprehension of these phenomena.üîΩ

original: rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing der longs spyod pa dang / skyid pa thams cad yongs su gzung ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing der longs spyod pa dang / skyid pa thams cad yongs su gzung ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as there is no grasping at wholesome and unwholesome, mundane and supramundane, contaminated and uncontaminated, conditioned and unconditioned phenomena, in the same way, after attaining unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, in that buddha-field, all enjoyments and happiness will be ungraspable.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ltar chos thams cad ni dmigs su med pa'i tshul gyis yongs su gzung ba med pa dang / chos thams cad yongs su gzung ba med pa'i phyir yang sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad ni dmigs su med pa'i tshul gyis yongs su gzung ba med pa dang / chos thams cad yongs su gzung ba med pa'i phyir yang sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: Because in that way, all phenomena are ungraspable by way of non-apprehending, and because all phenomena are ungraspable, he teaches the Dharma to sentient beings.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: In this way, Subh≈´ti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / dmigs su med pa dang / byung ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / dmigs su med pa dang / byung ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin te /
translated: they perfect the perfection of wisdom in all dharmas that are without a causal sign, without an agent, unapprehendable, not arisen, and not compounded.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subh≈´ti, in this way, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,üîΩthey perfect the perfections in all dharmas that are without a causal sign, without an agent, unapprehendable, not arisen, and not compounded.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: they perfect the perfection of giving in all dharmas that are without a causal sign, without an agent, unapprehendable, not arisen, and not compounded.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar du yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i chos nyid kyi gnas skabs kyi zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad skad cig gcig gis rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sems kyi skad cig gis
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar du yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i chos nyid kyi gnas skabs kyi zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad skad cig gcig gis rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sems kyi skad cig gis
translated: up to the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha are perfected.

original: mngon par rtogs pa ste gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa ste gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second clear realization, which is the realization of all uncontaminated dharmas in the state of the reality of karmic maturation in a single moment of mind that has the characteristic of realizing them in a single moment.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subh≈´ti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar chos thams cad dbyer ma mchis shing mtshan ma ma mchis pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa nyid lags na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar chos thams cad dbyer ma mchis shing mtshan ma ma mchis pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa nyid lags na /
translated: Lord, if all dharmas are undifferentiated and signless, empty of their own marks,

original: ji ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: How do they complete the cultivation of the six perfections‚Äîthe perfection of generosity, the perfection of moral discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur /
translated: the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom?

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos de dag kyang ji ltar na tha dad du gyur par gdags pa lags /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos de dag kyang ji ltar na tha dad du gyur par gdags pa lags /
translated: How are those dharmas with outflows and without outflows designated as different?

original: ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'dus pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'dus pa lags /
translated: How is the perfection of generosity included in the perfection of wisdom?

original: ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @214b par tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dus pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @214b par tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dus pa lags /
translated: How is the perfection of morality included in the perfection of wisdom?üîΩHow are the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, and the perfection of meditation included in the perfection of wisdom?üîΩHow are the emptinesses included in the perfection of wisdom?

original: ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar du 'dus pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar du 'dus pa lags /
translated: How are the applications of mindfulness included in the perfection of wisdom, up to how are the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha included in the perfection of wisdom?

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar mtshan ma ma mchis pa'i chos mtshan nyid gcig pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar mtshan ma ma mchis pa'i chos mtshan nyid gcig pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Lord, thus in these dharmas without marks, with one mark‚Äî

original: mtshan nyid med pa rnams la 'di ltar tha dad du byed pa dag rab tu 'byed pa lags /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa rnams la 'di ltar tha dad du byed pa dag rab tu 'byed pa lags /
translated: that is, with no mark‚Äîyou make a differentiation, you make a discrimination.‚ÄùüîΩThe Lord having been asked this,

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad cis bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad cis bka' stsal to //
translated: he said to the venerable Subh≈´ti,üîΩ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, it is because all dharmas are empty of all dharmas that the perfection of wisdom is the foremost, the best, the most excellent, the highest, the supreme, the most sublime, the unequalled perfection.

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subh≈´ti, here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la gnas shing sbyin pa yongs su gtong ngo //
analyzed: rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la gnas shing sbyin pa yongs su gtong ngo //
translated: give gifts while standing in the five appropriating aggregates that are like a dream.

original: tshul khrims srung ngo //üîΩbzod pa sgom mo //
analyzed: tshul khrims srung ngo // bzod pa sgom mo //
translated: They guard morality.üîΩThey cultivate patience.

original: brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: They make an effort at perseverance.

original: ting nge 'dzin sgom mo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin sgom mo //
translated: They cultivate concentration.

original: shes rab sgom mo ;
analyzed: shes rab sgom mo ;
translated: They cultivate wisdom.

original: / sgyu ma lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / chu zla lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / sgra brnyan lta bu dang / gzugs brnyan lta bu dang / dri za'i grong khyer lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la nye bar gnas shing sbyin pa yongs su gtong ngo //
analyzed: / sgyu ma lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / chu zla lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / sgra brnyan lta bu dang / gzugs brnyan lta bu dang / dri za'i grong khyer lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la nye bar gnas shing sbyin pa yongs su gtong ngo //
translated: They give gifts while standing in the five appropriating aggregates that are like an illusion, like a mirage, like a dream, like an optical aberration, like an echo, like a reflection, like a city of the gandharvas, like a magical creation.

original: tshul khrims srung ngo//üîΩbzod pa sgom mo //
analyzed: tshul khrims srung ngo// bzod pa sgom mo //
translated: They guard morality.üîΩThey cultivate patience.

original: brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: They make an effort at perseverance.

original: ting nge 'dzin sgom mo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin sgom mo //
translated: They cultivate concentration.

original: shes rab sgom mo //
analyzed: shes rab sgom mo //
translated: They cultivate wisdom.

original: de 'di ltar rtogs te /
analyzed: de 'di ltar rtogs te /
translated: He understands it in the following way:

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni rmi lam lta bu ste /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni rmi lam lta bu ste /
translated: The five grasping heaps are like a dream,

original: mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: lacking any defining characteristics.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni sgyu ma lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / chu zla lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang ; sgra brnyan lta bu dang / gzugs brnyan lta bu dang / dri za'i grong khyer lta bu dang /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni sgyu ma lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / chu zla lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang ; sgra brnyan lta bu dang / gzugs brnyan lta bu dang / dri za'i grong khyer lta bu dang /
translated: The five grasping heaps are like an illusion, a mirage, a reflection of the moon in water, an optical illusion, an echo, a reflection, a phantom city,

original: sprul ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: sprul ba lta bu ste /
translated: and a magical creation,

original: mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: lacking any defining characteristics.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: rmi lam la rang bzhin gang yang med do //
analyzed: rmi lam la rang bzhin gang yang med do //
translated: A dream has no intrinsic nature.

original: sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / chu zla dang / mig yor dang / sgra brnyan dang / gzugs brnyan dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / sprul pa la rang bzhin gang yang med do //
analyzed: sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / chu zla dang / mig yor dang / sgra brnyan dang / gzugs brnyan dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / sprul pa la rang bzhin gang yang med do //
translated: An illusion, a mirage, a reflection of the moon in water, an optical illusion, an echo, a reflection, a phantom city, and a magical creation have no intrinsic nature.

original: gang la rang bzhin med pa de la mtshan nyid med de gang la mtshan nyid med pa de ni 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'o zhes bya bar rtogs par byed do //üîΩrab 'byor rnam grangs des na khyod kyis /
analyzed: gang la rang bzhin med pa de la mtshan nyid med de gang la mtshan nyid med pa de ni 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'o zhes bya bar rtogs par byed do // rab 'byor rnam grangs des na khyod kyis /
translated: And whatever is without intrinsic nature is without characteristics. Whatever is without characteristics is thus characterized by the single characteristic of being without characteristics.üîΩSubh≈´ti, you should understand this

original: @215a * // 'di ltar rig par bya ste /üîΩsbyin pa ni mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: @215a * // 'di ltar rig par bya ste / sbyin pa ni mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: through this one of many explanations.üîΩGiving is without characteristics.

original: gtong ba ni mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: gtong ba ni mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: The giver is without characteristics.

original: len pa ni mtshan nyid med pa'o zhes bya bar shes par bya ste /üîΩgang de ltar shes nas sbyin pa gtong ba de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: len pa ni mtshan nyid med pa'o zhes bya bar shes par bya ste / gang de ltar shes nas sbyin pa gtong ba de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin te /
translated: The receiver is without characteristics.üîΩOne should understand it in this way.üîΩWhen one gives a gift with such an understanding, one perfects the perfection of generosity.

original: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed na /
analyzed: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed na /
translated: When one perfects the perfection of generosity,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las phyir mi ldog go //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las phyir mi ldog go //
translated: one does not turn back from the perfection of morality.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las phyir mi ldog go //
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las phyir mi ldog go //
translated: He does not turn back from the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom.

original: de pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag la gnas shing bsam gtan bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: de pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag la gnas shing bsam gtan bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúAbiding in those six perfections, he completes the four concentrations.

analyzed: tshangs pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He completes the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byed do //

translated: He completes the four right efforts, the four legs of magical power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of awakening, and the eightfold noble path.

analyzed: de 'phags pa'i chos 'jig rten las 'das pas thun mong ma yin pa rnam par smin pa las byung ba rnams la gnas shing phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa grangs med dpag tu med pa dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig

analyzed: longs spyod dang skyid pa thams cad kyis kyang sems can rnams kyi don byed do //

original: sbyin pas yongs su sdud do //
analyzed: sbyin pas yongs su sdud do //

analyzed: gang tshul khrims kyis yongs su bsdu ba de dag dang / gang bzod pas yongs su bsdu ba de dag dang / gang brtson 'grus kyis yongs su bsdu ba de dag dang / gang bsam gtan gyis yongs su bsdu ba de dag dang / gang shes rab kyis yongs su bsdu ba de dag kyang shes rab kyis yongs su sdud do //
translated: Those who are to be gathered by morality, those who are to be gathered by patience, those who are to be gathered by perseverance, those who are to be gathered by concentration, those who are to be gathered by wisdom, he gathers them with wisdom.

original: gang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyis yongs su bsdu ba de dag kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis yongs su sdud do //
analyzed: gang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyis yongs su bsdu ba de dag kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis yongs su sdud do //

analyzed: de ltar gang dang gang dge ba'i chos gang dang gang gis yongs su bsdu ba de dag kyang dge ba'i chos de dang de dag gis yongs su sdud do //
translated: Thus he gathers those who are to be gathered by whatever wholesome dharmas, with whatever wholesome dharmas.

original: de dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang ldan zhing chos thams cad la dbang bsgyur bas 'khor ba de nye bar len kyang 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis mi gos te /

translated: Endowed with those roots of virtue, and having mastered all phenomena, they take up sa·πÉsƒÅra, but are not sullied by the sufferings of sa·πÉsƒÅra.

analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa de dag gis sems can rnams yongs su sdud do //

original: de chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par shes pas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu shes kyang de la mi gnas so //
analyzed: de chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par shes pas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu shes kyang de la mi gnas so //
translated: ‚ÄúKnowing that all phenomena are without defining characteristics, they know the fruit of entering the stream, but they do not rest in that.

analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid shes kyang de la mi gnas so //
translated: They know the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, and arhatship, but they do not rest in that.

original: rang byang chub shes kyang de la mi gnas so //
analyzed: rang byang chub shes kyang de la mi gnas so //
translated: They know individual enlightenment, but they do not rest in that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: 'di ltar nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir te /

translated: because they are not shared in common with all the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas, and in order to attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mtshan nyid med par shes so //

analyzed: rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la gnas /
translated: they dwell in the five appropriating aggregates that are like a dream,

original: sgyu ma lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / chu zla lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / sgra brnyan lta bu dang / gzugs brnyan lta bu dang / dri za'i grong @216a * //

translated: Like an illusion,üîΩlike a mirage,üîΩlike a reflection of the moon in water,üîΩlike an apparition,üîΩlike an echo,üîΩlike a reflection,üîΩlike a city of gandharvas,üîΩ

original: khyer lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la gnas shing tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: khyer lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la gnas shing tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //

analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das nyan thos rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa gang lags pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa gang lags pa'i bzod pa de dag la bye brag tu bgyi ba ci mchis / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Subhuti : What is the difference between the acquiescence in dharmas which are not produced by the Disciples and Pratyekabuddhas, and the acquiescence in dharmas which are not produced by the Bodhisattvas, the great beings?

original: rab 'byor rgyun du zhugs pa'i shes pa gang yin pa dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'o //üîΩlan cig phyir 'ong ba'i shes pa gang yin pa dang spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor rgyun du zhugs pa'i shes pa gang yin pa dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'o // lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i shes pa gang yin pa dang spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'o //
translated: The Lord : The knowledge and the forsaking of the Streamwinner are the acquiescence in dharmas which are not produced by the Bodhisattvas, the great beings.üîΩThe knowledge and the forsaking of the Once-Returner, of the Never-Returner, of the Arhat, of the Pratyekabuddha,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i shes pa gang yin pa dang spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i shes pa gang yin pa dang spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'o //
translated: are the acquiescence in dharmas which are not produced by the Bodhisattvas, the great beings.

original: dgra bcom pa'i shes pa gang yin pa dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i shes pa gang yin pa dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'o //
translated: That knowledge and that abandonment of an arhat is the forbearance of a bodhisattva great being.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi shes pa gang yin pa dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa ste /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi shes pa gang yin pa dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa ste /

original: rab 'byor de ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi bzod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'i bye brag yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi bzod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'i bye brag yin no //
translated: Subh≈´ti, that is the difference between the forbearance of ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas and the forbearance of bodhisattvas.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni bzod pa de lta bu dang ldan pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas de dag thams cad zil gyis gnon te /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni bzod pa de lta bu dang ldan pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas de dag thams cad zil gyis gnon te /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, a bodhisattva great being endowed with such forbearance surpasses all those ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mi skye ba'i chos gyi  bzod pa la gnas te /
analyzed: de rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mi skye ba'i chos gyi  bzod pa la gnas te /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam la spyod cing lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed de /

analyzed: de yongs su rdzogs pas byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stong @218b pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams dang mi 'bral ba yin /

analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /

analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //

analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: ‚ÄúFurthermore, Subh≈´ti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la gnas /

analyzed: sgra brnyan lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la gnas shing mtshan ma med pa'i lus dang sems kyi brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: and they stand in the five appropriating aggregates that are like a phantom, and they stand in the five appropriating aggregates that are like an illusion, and they stand in the five appropriating aggregates that are like a magical creation, and they practice with a body and mind that are without marks.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti said,

translated: ‚ÄúLord, how do bodhisattva great beings, standing in the five appropriating aggregates that are without a mark, complete the perfection of perseverance?‚Äù

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni lus dang sems kyi brtson 'grus rtsom par byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, here the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva applies the effort of body and mind.

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed cing sems can rnams kyi don byed do //

translated: Having brought sentient beings to maturity with that physical effort, he causes them to enter the three vehicles and trains and establishes them.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /

translated: Subh≈´ti, in that way the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //üîΩde sems @219a * //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do // de sems @219a * //
translated: He perfects the perfection of effort that is devoid of characteristics.

original: kyi brtson 'grus zag pa med pa lam gyi yan lag tu gyur pa lam gyi khongs su chud pas brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang du dge ba'i chos 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kyi brtson 'grus zag pa med pa lam gyi yan lag tu gyur pa lam gyi khongs su chud pas brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang du dge ba'i chos 'di lta ste /
translated: He is endowed with the effort of mind that is undefiled, that is a branch of the path, and that is included in the path.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang ; stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang ; stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
translated: The perfection of effort is the wholesome dharmas, namely: the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four bases of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of awakening, and the noble eightfold path.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang /

translated: the four formless absorptions, the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, the ten powers of the tathƒÅgatas,

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad khongs su 'dus pa /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad khongs su 'dus pa /
translated: the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, great loving kindness, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.

original: yongs su rdzogs par byed do ;

translated: He or she will perfect them.

analyzed: de bskor bas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnam pa drug tu g-yo ba dang / rab tu g-yo ba dang / kun nas g-yo ba dang / 'gul ba dang / rab tu 'gul ba dang / kun nas 'gul ba dang /

translated: and all of them

analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /

analyzed: rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la gnas /
translated: they abide in the five grasping aggregates that are like a dream,

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti said:

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mtshan nyid med pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams la gnas nas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa lags /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //

analyzed: de ro myong bar byed pa med pas ting nge 'dzin de dag gis kyang gzugs kyi khams sam /
translated: Since they do not savor those meditative attainments, they do not take birth in the form realm through those meditative attainments.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su skye par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su skye par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since he does not savor those meditative stabilities, he does not take rebirth in the form or formless worlds on account of those meditative stabilities.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar des khams de nyid kyang mi dmigs /
analyzed: 'di ltar des khams de nyid kyang mi dmigs /

original: gang snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gang gis snyoms par 'jug pa de yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gang snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gang gis snyoms par 'jug pa de yang mi dmigs so //

translated: By means of the meditative absorption that is without attributes, he perfects the transcendent perfection of meditative stability.

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa des nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis las yongs su 'da'o //

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /

translated: feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness do not have an intrinsic nature;

original: gang la rang bzhin med pa de ni brjod du med pa'o //
analyzed: gang la rang bzhin med pa de ni brjod du med pa'o //
translated: that which does not have an intrinsic nature is inexpressible.

analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la rang bzhin med de /

original: gang la rang bzhin med pa de ni brjod du med pa'o //
analyzed: gang la rang bzhin med pa de ni brjod du med pa'o //
translated: that which does not have an intrinsic nature is inexpressible.

analyzed: pha rol tu @221b phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la rang bzhin med de /
translated: All the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the dharmas on the side of awakening do not have an intrinsic nature;

original: gang la rang bzhin med pa de ni brjod du med pa'o //
analyzed: gang la rang bzhin med pa de ni brjod du med pa'o //
translated: that which does not have an intrinsic nature is inexpressible.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /

translated: The noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness,

original: gang la rang bzhi med pa de ni brjod du med pa'o //
analyzed: gang la rang bzhi med pa de ni brjod du med pa'o //
translated: That which is without any intrinsic nature is inexpressible.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la rang bzhin med de /

translated: That which is without any intrinsic nature is inexpressible.üîΩThe emptiness of the compounded, the emptiness of the uncompounded, and the emptiness of the ultimate are all without any intrinsic nature.

This is the realization in a single moment of mind, which has the characteristic of the realization in a single moment of the absence of marks of all phenomena, the third.

analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la chags pa med do // nang stong pa nyid @223a * //
translated: He is not attached to the perfection of discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence, the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom.

original: la chags pa med do //
analyzed: la chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to inner emptiness.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la chags pa med do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la chags pa med do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /üîΩmtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams la chags pa med do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams la chags pa med do //
translated: signlessness, and aspirationlessness,

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la chag pa med do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la chag pa med do //
translated: the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ gateways,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la chags pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la chags pa med do //
translated: the powers of the tathƒÅgatas, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la chags pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to the knowledge of all aspects up to omniscience.

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la gnas shing sa dang po yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la gnas shing sa dang po yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: Standing in this perfection of wisdom, he will fully complete the first level.

original: de la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags mi bskyed do //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags mi bskyed do //
translated: He will not arouse the passion of sensual desire for it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: de ni 'di ltar des sa de yang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar des sa de yang mi dmigs na /

analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags skye bar lta ga la 'gyur te /

translated: Standing in this perfection of wisdom, he will fully complete the second, third, fourth, fifth, sixth, seventh, eighth, ninth,

analyzed: sa bcu pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de /

original: de la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags mi bskyed do //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags mi bskyed do //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: de ni 'di ltar des sa de yang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar des sa de yang mi dmigs na /

original: de la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags bskyed par lta ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags bskyed par lta ga la 'gyur te /

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de yang mi dmigs so //
translated: They practice the perfection of wisdom, but they do not apprehend that perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa der chos thams cad kyang 'dus par mthong ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa der chos thams cad kyang 'dus par mthong ste /

original: chos de dag kyang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: chos de dag kyang mi dmigs so //
translated: But they do not apprehend those dharmas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

analyzed: de ni 'di ltar chos de dag dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de ni 'di ltar chos de dag ni tha dad du bya ba gang yang med do //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar chos de dag ni tha dad du bya ba gang yang med do //

original: chos kyi dbyings su bstan pa dang / de bzhin nyid du @223b bstan pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' bstan pas chos thams cad dbyer med do //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings su bstan pa dang / de bzhin nyid du @223b bstan pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' bstan pas chos thams cad dbyer med do //

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ltar chos thams cad dbyer med pa lags na ji ltar dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i chos rnams bstan pa lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ltar chos thams cad dbyer med pa lags na ji ltar dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i chos rnams bstan pa lags /

analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams bstan pa lags /

analyzed: ji ltar thag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa ma mchis pa'i chos rnams bstan pa lags /

analyzed: ji ltar 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams bstan pa lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems / chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de la 'dus byas sam /

analyzed: 'dus ma byas sam /

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: Is it the result of stream enterer,

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /

original: dgra bcom pa nyid dam /üîΩrang byang chub bam /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid dam / rang byang chub bam /
translated: the state of a worthy one,üîΩthe awakening of a solitary buddha,

analyzed: byang chub bam /
translated: or the complete buddhahood of a buddha?

original: sems gang yang brjod du yod dam /
analyzed: sems gang yang brjod du yod dam /
translated: Is any mind expressible?‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúBlessed One, it is not.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, what do you think?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //üîΩbcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Subhuti: No, Lord.

original: rab 'byor de bas na khyod kyis rnam grangs des 'di ltar chos thams cad dbyer med pa dang / chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bas na khyod kyis rnam grangs des 'di ltar chos thams cad dbyer med pa dang / chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med par rig par bya'o //
translated: The Lord: Therefore, Subhuti, you should know that all dharmas are undifferentiated, that all dharmas are signless, that all dharmas are produced by mental construction, that all dharmas are unborn and unceasing, that all dharmas are immaculate, that all dharmas are unspotted.

original: rab 'byor nga sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor nga sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe /

analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba'am / tshor ba zhes bya ba'am /

analyzed: 'du shes zhes bya ba'am / 'du byed ces bya ba'am /
translated: Did you apprehend feeling, perception, the mental formations, or consciousness, or apprehend them as subject to origination, or as subject to cessation?üîΩDid you apprehend the elements of ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind, or apprehend them as subject to origination, or as subject to cessation?üîΩDid you apprehend form, sound, smell, taste, touch, or mental objects, or apprehend them as subject to origination, or as subject to cessation?üîΩDid you apprehend the elements of eye, form, eye-consciousness, or eye-contact, or apprehend them as subject to origination, or as subject to cessation?üîΩDid you apprehend the elements of ear, sound, ear-consciousness, or ear-contact, or apprehend them as subject to origination, or as subject to cessation?üîΩDid you apprehend the elements of nose, smell, nose-consciousness, or nose-contact, or apprehend them as subject to origination, or as subject to cessation?üîΩDid you apprehend the elements of tongue, taste, tongue-consciousness, or tongue-contact, or apprehend them as subject to origination, or as subject to cessation?üîΩDid you apprehend the elements of body, touch, body-consciousness, or body-contact, or apprehend them as subject to origination, or as subject to cessation?

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Did you apprehend the elements of mind, mental objects, mind-consciousness, or mind-contact, or apprehend them as subject to origination, or as subject to cessation?

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba'am /üîΩpha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba'am /üîΩpha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Did you apprehend the elements of earth, water, fire, or wind, or apprehend them as subject to origination, or as subject to cessation?üîΩDid you apprehend the elements of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind, or apprehend them as subject to origination, or as subject to cessation?üîΩDid you apprehend the elements of form,

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar zhes bya ba'am /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang ; zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa dang /

analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba'am /

translated: or the result of once-returner,

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar zhes bya ba'i chos gang gi rang bzhin yang mi dmigs so //

translated: In this way, Subh≈´ti, should a bodhisattva great being train in the perfection of wisdom, by way of signlessness.

translated: ‚ÄúFurthermore, Subh≈´ti, all those uncontaminated dharmas, which are like a dream, which are not endowed with an existent thing, which are of the nature of a nonexistent thing, which are empty of their own mark, and which are completely purified in every way, have a nature

analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: Subh≈´ti, bodhisattva great beings should train in the perfection of wisdom like that.‚Äù

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti said,

translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One, what are all these uncontaminated phenomena?‚Äù
