analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / zad par gyi skye mched bcu dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / zad par gyi skye mched bcu dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad dang /
translated: ‚ÄúThey are the thirty-seven factors of awakening, the four immeasurables, the eight liberations, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, the ten universal bases, the eight spheres of mastery,

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon nas mkhyen pa dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / rnam pa thams cad du yongs su dag pa bzhi dang / dbang bcu dang stobs bcu dang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon nas mkhyen pa dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / rnam pa thams cad du yongs su dag pa bzhi dang / dbang bcu dang stobs bcu dang /
translated: the concentration of the absence of conflict, the knowledge through resolve, the six superknowledges, the four forms of correct understanding, the four complete purities, the ten powers, and the ten strengths.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang ; bsrung ba med pa gsum dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dang / bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid dang / bag chags yang dag par bcom pa dang / thugs rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang ; bsrung ba med pa gsum dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dang / bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid dang / bag chags yang dag par bcom pa dang / thugs rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang /
translated: the four fearlessnesses, the three unshared qualities, the three establishments of mindfulness, the nature of being without forgetfulness, the complete destruction of the traces, great compassion, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dag ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dag ste /
translated: the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of the aspects of the path, and the knowledge of all things,

original: rab 'byor 'di dag ni zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di dag ni zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad ces bya'o //
translated: Subh≈´ti, these are called all the uncontaminated dharmas.

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku yin no /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku yin no /
translated: Subh≈´ti, bodhisattva great beings should train in this perfection of wisdom.‚Äù This is the essential body.

original: // / rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la bslabs shing chos de dag thams cad thob nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: // / rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la bslabs shing chos de dag thams cad thob nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: ‚ÄúFurthermore, Subh≈´ti, having trained in this perfection of wisdom and attained all those dharmas, they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: thams cad du thams cad rnam pa thams cad nas thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: thams cad du thams cad rnam pa thams cad nas thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis brgyan pa /
translated: In every way, in all aspects, in every way, the tathƒÅgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas, their bodies adorned with the thirty-two major marks of a great person,

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan pa /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan pa /
translated: adorned with the eighty minor signs,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la theg pa chen po mchog gi chos kyi longs spyod @225a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la theg pa chen po mchog gi chos kyi longs spyod @225a * //
translated: give the enjoyment of the supreme Dharma of the Great Vehicle to the bodhisattva great beings,

original: bla na med pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / tshim pa dang / rab tu dga' ba ston par mdzad par 'gyur ro zhes /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / tshim pa dang / rab tu dga' ba ston par mdzad par 'gyur ro zhes /
translated: and they demonstrate unsurpassed joy, happiness, satisfaction, and delight.‚Äù

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' ;
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' ;
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, bodhisattva great beings

original: chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin no /
analyzed: chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin no /
translated: This is the enjoyment body.

original: // / rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab pa na chos de dag thams cad rtogs par byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams
analyzed: // / rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab pa na chos de dag thams cad rtogs par byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams
translated: Moreover, Subh≈´ti, when training in the perfection of wisdom, having realized all those dharmas, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment, in the limitless, endless world systems in the ten directions,

original: dpag tu med mtha' med par dus thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku'i sprul pa sna tshogs kyi sprin gyis sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad pa de ltar rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa'
analyzed: dpag tu med mtha' med par dus thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku'i sprul pa sna tshogs kyi sprin gyis sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad pa de ltar rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa'
translated: at all times, by means of various emanations of the body of the TathƒÅgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha, he performs the welfare of all sentient beings.üîΩIn that way, Subh≈´ti, the bodhisattva great being should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i sku yin no /
analyzed: chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i sku yin no /
translated: This is the emanation body.

original: // / de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //üîΩbcom ldan 'das chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu dngos po ma mchis pa dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa rnams la 'di dag ni dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: // / de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to // bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu dngos po ma mchis pa dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa rnams la 'di dag ni dge ba'i chos so //
translated: Then the venerable Subh≈´ti said to the Lord:

original: 'di dag ni mi dge ba'i chos so //üîΩ'di dag ni 'jig rten pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni mi dge ba'i chos so // 'di dag ni 'jig rten pa'i chos so //
translated: ‚ÄúLord, in regard to all dharmas that are like a dream, non-entities, the nonexistence of the own-being, empty of their own marks, what is the wholesome dharma, what is the unwholesome dharma,

original: 'di dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos so //üîΩ'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos so // 'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos so //
translated: what is the worldly dharma, what is the supramundane dharma,

original: 'di dag ni zag pa med pa'i chos so //üîΩ'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni zag pa med pa'i chos so // 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi chos so //
translated: what is the dharma with outflows, what is the dharma without outflows,

original: 'di dag ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos so //
translated: what is the compounded dharma, what is the uncompounded dharma,

original: 'di dag ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: what is the dharma that leads to the realization of the fruit of entering the stream,

original: 'di dag ni lan cig phyir cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni lan cig phyir cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: These are the causes for actualizing the fruit of once-returner, the fruit of non-returner, and the fruit of arhatship.

original: 'di dag ni rang byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur ba'o //üîΩ'di dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur ba'o zhes bgyi bar ji ltar rnam par dgod par 'gyur chos thams cad sgra brnyan lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang /
analyzed: 'di dag ni rang byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur ba'o // 'di dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur ba'o zhes bgyi bar ji ltar rnam par dgod par 'gyur chos thams cad sgra brnyan lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang /
translated: These are the causes for pratyekabuddha enlightenment.üîΩThese are the causes for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúAll phenomena are like an echo, like a mirage, like a phantom, like a dream,

original: smig rgyu lta bu dang / dngos po ma mchis pa dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa rnams la 'di dag ni dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: smig rgyu lta bu dang / dngos po ma mchis pa dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa rnams la 'di dag ni dge ba'i chos so //
translated: like a magical creation, like a reflection of the moon in water, like an optical aberration, and they are non-entities, the non-entityness of essential nature, and empty of their own defining characteristics. How can you establish that ‚Äòthese are wholesome phenomena,

original: 'di dag ni mi dge ba'i @225b chos so //üîΩ'di dag ni 'jig rten pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni mi dge ba'i @225b chos so // 'di dag ni 'jig rten pa'i chos so //
translated: these are unwholesome phenomena,üîΩthese are mundane phenomena,

original: 'di dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos so //
translated: these are supramundane phenomena,

original: 'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos so //
translated: These are the dharmas with outflows.

original: 'di dag ni zag pa med pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni zag pa med pa'i chos so //
translated: These are the dharmas without outflows.

original: 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi chos so //
translated: These are the conditioned dharmas.

original: 'di dag ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos so //
translated: These are the unconditioned dharmas.

original: 'di dag ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur ro //
translated: These are the causes for actualizing the fruit of stream-entry.

original: 'di dag ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: These are the causes for actualizing the fruit of once-returning, the fruit of non-returning, and the fruit of arhatship.

original: 'di dag ni rang byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rang byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: These are the causes for individual enlightenment.

original: 'di dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur ba'o zhes bgyi bar ji ltar rnam par dgod par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur ba'o zhes bgyi bar ji ltar rnam par dgod par 'gyur /
translated: These are the causes for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,üîΩ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, it is like this:

original: rab 'byor 'di la byis pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa'i so so'i skye bo ni rmi lam yang dmigs la rmi lam mthong ba yang dmigs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byis pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa'i so so'i skye bo ni rmi lam yang dmigs la rmi lam mthong ba yang dmigs so //
translated: Subh≈´ti, here the foolish, untrained, ordinary person perceives a dream and perceives one who sees a dream.

original: skra brnyan yang dmigs la sgra brnyan pa yang dmigs so //
analyzed: skra brnyan yang dmigs la sgra brnyan pa yang dmigs so //
translated: He perceives an echo and perceives one who hears an echo.

original: mig yor yang dmigs la mig yor mthong ba yang dmigs so //üîΩsgyu ma yang dmigs la sgyu ma mthong ba yang dmigs so //üîΩsmig rgyu yang dmigs la smig rgyu mthong ba yang dmigs so //
analyzed: mig yor yang dmigs la mig yor mthong ba yang dmigs so // sgyu ma yang dmigs la sgyu ma mthong ba yang dmigs so // smig rgyu yang dmigs la smig rgyu mthong ba yang dmigs so //
translated: He perceives an optical aberration and perceives one who sees an optical aberration.üîΩHe perceives an illusion and perceives one who sees an illusion.üîΩHe perceives a mirage and perceives one who sees a mirage.

original: sprul pa yang dmigs la sprul pa mthong ba yang dmigs so //
analyzed: sprul pa yang dmigs la sprul pa mthong ba yang dmigs so //
translated: He perceives a magical creation and perceives one who sees a magical creation.

original: des rmi lam yang dmigs la rmi lam mthong ba yang dmigs so //
analyzed: des rmi lam yang dmigs la rmi lam mthong ba yang dmigs so //
translated: He perceives a dream and perceives one who sees a dream.

original: sprul pa'i bar yang dmigs la sprul pa mthong ba yang dmigs nas /
analyzed: sprul pa'i bar yang dmigs la sprul pa mthong ba yang dmigs nas /
translated: Up to he perceives a magical creation and perceives one who sees a magical creation.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis dge ba'i 'du bya ba yang mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis dge ba'i 'du bya ba yang mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: He creates virtuous compositional activity with body, speech, and mind.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis mi dge ba'i 'du bya ba yang mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis mi dge ba'i 'du bya ba yang mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: He creates nonvirtuous compositional activity with body, speech, and mind.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mig yo ba'i 'du bya ba yang mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mig yo ba'i 'du bya ba yang mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: He also creates merit, demerit, and the conditions for error with his body, speech, and mind.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid 'di gnyis la gnas shing sems can rnams la chos ston te /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid 'di gnyis la gnas shing sems can rnams la chos ston te /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom, abiding in these two kinds of emptiness‚Äîthe emptiness of the limitless and the emptiness of no beginning or end‚Äîteaches the Dharma to sentient beings.

original: khams gsum po 'di ni stong pa ste /
analyzed: khams gsum po 'di ni stong pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄòThis three-realm world is empty.

original: 'di la gzugs sam /
analyzed: 'di la gzugs sam /
translated: There is no form here,üîΩno feeling,

original: tshor ba'am / 'du shes sam /
analyzed: tshor ba'am / 'du shes sam /
translated: no perception,

original: 'du byed dam /
analyzed: 'du byed dam /
translated: no volitional factors,

original: rnam par shes pa'am /üîΩskye mched rnams sam /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'am / skye mched rnams sam /
translated: and no consciousness.

original: khams rnams med do //
analyzed: khams rnams med do //
translated: There are no sense fields and no elements.

original: 'di ni rmi lam /üîΩ'di ni sgra brnyan /üîΩ'di ni mig yor /
analyzed: 'di ni rmi lam / 'di ni sgra brnyan / 'di ni mig yor /
translated: This is a dream.üîΩThis is an echo.üîΩThis is an optical illusion.

original: 'di ni @226a * //üîΩsgyu ma ; 'di ni smig rgyu /
analyzed: 'di ni @226a * // sgyu ma ; 'di ni smig rgyu /
translated: This is an apparition.üîΩThis is a mirage.

original: 'di ni sprul pa ste /üîΩ'di la phung po rnams sam /
analyzed: 'di ni sprul pa ste / 'di la phung po rnams sam /
translated: This is a magical creation.üîΩThere are no aggregates here,

original: khams rnams sam /
analyzed: khams rnams sam /
translated: no elements,üîΩand no sense bases.

original: skye mched rnams med do //üîΩ'di la ni rmi lam med do //
analyzed: skye mched rnams med do // 'di la ni rmi lam med do //
translated: The sense sources do not exist.üîΩThere are no dreams here.

original: rmi lam mthong ba med do //
analyzed: rmi lam mthong ba med do //
translated: There is no one who sees dreams.

original: sgra brnyan med do //
analyzed: sgra brnyan med do //
translated: There are no echoes.

original: sgra brnyan nyan pa med do //üîΩmig yor med do //
analyzed: sgra brnyan nyan pa med do // mig yor med do //
translated: There is no one who hears echoes.üîΩThere are no optical illusions.

original: mig yor mthong pa med do //
analyzed: mig yor mthong pa med do //
translated: There is no one who sees optical illusions.

original: sgyu ma med do //üîΩsgyu ma byed pa med do //
analyzed: sgyu ma med do // sgyu ma byed pa med do //
translated: There are no illusions.üîΩThere are no illusion-makers.

original: smig rgyu med do //
analyzed: smig rgyu med do //
translated: There are no mirages.

original: smig rgyu mthong ba med do //üîΩsprul pa med do //
analyzed: smig rgyu mthong ba med do // sprul pa med do //
translated: There is no one who sees mirages.üîΩThere are no emanations.

original: sprul pa byed pa med do //
analyzed: sprul pa byed pa med do //
translated: There are no emanators.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni dngos po med pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni dngos po med pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
translated: All these phenomena are unreal and have the nature of unreality.

original: 'on kyang khyod ni phung po med pa la phung por 'du shes pa /
analyzed: 'on kyang khyod ni phung po med pa la phung por 'du shes pa /
translated: Nevertheless, you perceive what is not a skandha as a skandha,

original: skye mched med pa la skye mched du 'du shes pa dang / khams med pa la khams su 'du shes pa dag ste /
analyzed: skye mched med pa la skye mched du 'du shes pa dang / khams med pa la khams su 'du shes pa dag ste /
translated: you perceive what is not a sense source as a sense source, and you perceive what is not an element as an element.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba phyin ci log las skye ba las kyi rnam par smin pas yongs su bzung ba yin na /
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba phyin ci log las skye ba las kyi rnam par smin pas yongs su bzung ba yin na /
translated: All these phenomena arise from error in relation to dependent origination. They are produced by the ripening of karma.

original: khyed rnams ci'i phyir chos thams cad dngos po med pa la dngos po'i 'du shes su byed ces te /
analyzed: khyed rnams ci'i phyir chos thams cad dngos po med pa la dngos po'i 'du shes su byed ces te /
translated: Why do you take as real what is unreal?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: thabs mkhas pas sems can ser sna can de dag ser sna las rnam par bzlog nas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor te sbyin pa yongs su btang ba de yang de dag la longs spyod chen po'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas sems can ser sna can de dag ser sna las rnam par bzlog nas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor te sbyin pa yongs su btang ba de yang de dag la longs spyod chen po'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: with skillful means they turn those stingy sentient beings away from stinginess and connect them to the perfection of generosity, and that giving of theirs becomes the cause for great enjoyment.

original: des de dag las bskyod nas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor te /
analyzed: des de dag las bskyod nas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor te /
translated: Having turned them away from that, they connect them to the perfection of morality.

original: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa de yang de dag la mtho ris su skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa de yang de dag la mtho ris su skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: That taking up of morality becomes the cause for them to be reborn in the higher realms.

original: des de dag las bskyod nas ting nge 'dzin la sbyor te /
analyzed: des de dag las bskyod nas ting nge 'dzin la sbyor te /
translated: Having turned them away from that, they connect them to concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin de yang de dag la tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de yang de dag la tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: That concentration becomes the cause for them to be reborn in the world of BrahmƒÅ.

original: des de dag las bskyod nas bsam gtan dang po la sbyor te /üîΩbsam gtan dang po las bsam gtan gnyis pa /
analyzed: des de dag las bskyod nas bsam gtan dang po la sbyor te / bsam gtan dang po las bsam gtan gnyis pa /
translated: Having turned them away from those, he joins them to the first concentration.üîΩFrom the first concentration, he joins them to the second concentration.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa las bsam gtan gsum pa /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa las bsam gtan gsum pa /
translated: From the second concentration, he joins them to the third concentration.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa las bsam gtan bzhi pa /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa las bsam gtan bzhi pa /
translated: From the third concentration, he joins them to the fourth concentration.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa las nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa las nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa /
translated: From the fourth concentration, he joins them to the meditative attainment of the base of infinite space.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa las rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa /üîΩrnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa las cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms @226b par 'jug pa /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa las rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa las cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms @226b par 'jug pa /
translated: From the meditative attainment of the base of infinite space, he joins them to the meditative attainment of the base of infinite consciousness.üîΩFrom the meditative attainment of the base of infinite consciousness, he joins them to the meditative attainment of the base of nothingness.

original: cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa las 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa las 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la sbyor ro //
translated: From the meditative attainment of the base of nothingness, he joins them to the meditative attainment of the base of neither discrimination nor non-discrimination.

original: des sbyin pa dang sbyin pa'i 'bras bu dma' ba de las rnam grangs su bskyed de /
analyzed: des sbyin pa dang sbyin pa'i 'bras bu dma' ba de las rnam grangs su bskyed de /

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang /
translated: the four noble truths, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, the three gates of liberation,

analyzed: snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la 'god do //

original: rab tu 'jog go //
analyzed: rab tu 'jog go //
translated: They establish them and they fully establish them.

original: de zag pa med pa'i chos gzugs med pa bstan du med pa thogs pa med pa de dag gis gang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu don du gnyer ba de dag rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: de zag pa med pa'i chos gzugs med pa bstan du med pa thogs pa med pa de dag gis gang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu don du gnyer ba de dag rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu 'god do //
translated: They establish in the fruit of stream-entry those who seek the fruit of stream-entry,

analyzed: gang lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu don du gnyer ba de dag lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rab tu 'god do //
translated: in the fruit of once-returning those who seek the fruit of once-returning,

analyzed: gang phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu don du gnyer pa de dag phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rab tu 'god do //

analyzed: gang dgra bcom pa nyid don du gnyer ba de dag dgra bcom pa nyid la rab tu 'god do //

original: yang dag par bskul lo //
analyzed: yang dag par bskul lo //

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod do //üîΩyang dag par dga' bar byed do //üîΩ'dul lo // gzhog go //

original: rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: rab tu 'god do //

analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyid la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Thus, when the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva practices this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom,üîΩall phenomena are the essential nature that is without entityness, all phenomena are emptiness that transcends extremes, and all phenomena are emptiness that is without beginning or end.

original: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / chos thams cad mtha' las 'das ba stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la 'di dag ni dge ba'i chos so //
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / chos thams cad mtha' las 'das ba stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la 'di dag ni dge ba'i chos so //
translated: These are virtuous phenomena.

original: 'di dag ni mi dge ba'i chos so //üîΩ'di dag ni 'jig rten pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni mi dge ba'i chos so // 'di dag ni 'jig rten pa'i chos so //

original: 'di dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos so //
translated: These are supramundane phenomena.

original: 'di dag ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i chos so //

original: 'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos so //
translated: These are phenomena with defilements.

original: 'di dag ni zag pa med pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni zag pa med pa'i chos so //
translated: These are phenomena without defilements.

original: 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi chos so //

original: 'di dag ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos so //
translated: These are unconditioned phenomena.

original: 'di dag ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //

translated: Subh≈´ti, if you know the qualities of the bodhisattva great beings‚Äô marvel and wonder, then all ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddas will not be able to repay the bodhisattva great beings‚Äô

analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dang / slob pa rnams dang / lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis smad par 'gyur te /
translated: If he thinks like that, he will be criticized by the Lord Buddhas, by the bodhisattva great beings, by the pratyekabuddhas, by the arhats, by the trainees, and by the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: de la @229b thog mar sems can thams cad kyi mgon gyis shig ce'am /
analyzed: de la @229b thog mar sems can thams cad kyi mgon gyis shig ce'am /
translated: They will criticize him, saying, ‚ÄòFirst you should be a protector of all beings.

original: gnas dang skyabs dang dpung gnyen gyis shig ces gsol ba btab ces smad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas dang skyabs dang dpung gnyen gyis shig ces gsol ba btab ces smad par 'gyur ro //
translated: You should be a refuge, a support, and a friend.‚Äô

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du mir gyur pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du mir gyur pa'am /

analyzed: mi ma yin par gyur pa dag 'ongs nas bdag ni slong mo pa'o zhes yan lag bcad par gsol ba btab na de'i tshe des sbyin nam mi sbyin snyam pa'i sems gnyis su bskyed par mi bya'o //
translated: If non-human beings come and ask for a limb, he should not arouse two thoughts, thinking, ‚ÄúShould I give it or not?‚Äù

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des sems can rnams kyi don du ched du bsams te /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des sems can rnams kyi don du ched du bsams te /
translated: Because, Subh≈´ti, it is like this: that bodhisattva great being, for the sake of beings, deliberately

analyzed: lus 'dis bdag gis sems can thams cad kyi don bya'o zhes lus yongs su bzung bas na de 'di snyam du bdag gis sems can 'di dag gi don du lus yongs su bzung bas na de dag blang mi dgos par khyer cig dengs shig ces sems bskyed par
translated: takes up this body, thinking, ‚ÄúI will work for the welfare of all beings with this body.‚Äù He should arouse the thought, ‚ÄúSince I have taken up this body for the sake of these beings, they can take it away without my having to ask for it, and go.‚Äù

original: bya ste / rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bya ste / rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: Subh≈´ti, bodhisattva great beings should train in the perfection of wisdom like that.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos slong mo pa mthong na 'di snyam du chos 'di dag thams cad kyi rang bzhin dmigs su med na /üîΩ'di la su zhig ni sbyin pa yongs su gtong /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos slong mo pa mthong na 'di snyam du chos 'di dag thams cad kyi rang bzhin dmigs su med na / 'di la su zhig ni sbyin pa yongs su gtong /
translated: Furthermore, Subh≈´ti, when a bodhisattva great being sees a beggar, he should think, ‚ÄúThe intrinsic nature of all these dharmas is not apprehended.üîΩWho here gives a gift?

original: su la ni sbyin par bya /
analyzed: su la ni sbyin par bya /
translated: To whom should I give?

original: ci zhig ni sbyin par bya zhes sems bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: ci zhig ni sbyin par bya zhes sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: What should I give?‚Äù

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

analyzed: 'di ltar chos 'di dag ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis stong pa ste /
translated: Because these dharmas are empty of the emptiness that transcends extremes.

analyzed: stong pa nyid la ni gang la yang yongs su stong pa'am gang las kyang phrogs pa med do //
translated: In emptiness, there is nothing that is emptied or anything from which it is emptied.

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyi pa dang / 'di lta ste nang stong pa nyid nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyi pa dang / 'di lta ste nang stong pa nyid nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la bslab par bya'o //
translated: Subh≈´ti, bodhisattva great beings should train in the perfection of wisdom like that, that is, in inner emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: de stong pa nyid la ngas shing sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba de'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /

original: de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa des phyi nang gi dngos po gcod cing gtubs kyang bdag la su yang gtub pa'am gcod do snyam pa'i sems mi 'byung ngo zhes pa ni sprul pa'i sku'i sgo nas chos kyi sku'i phrin las spyir
analyzed: de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa des phyi nang gi dngos po gcod cing gtubs kyang bdag la su yang gtub pa'am gcod do snyam pa'i sems mi 'byung ngo zhes pa ni sprul pa'i sku'i sgo nas chos kyi sku'i phrin las spyir
translated: Through the perfection of generosity being completed, even though I cut and chop up my inner and outer things, I will not think, 'Someone is cutting me up or chopping me up.'

original: bstan pa yin no /üîΩ// / rab 'byor ngas 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs @230a * //
analyzed: bstan pa yin no / // / rab 'byor ngas 'di nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs @230a * //

translated: Subhuti, I see with the eye of the Buddha that in the eastern direction, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, there are bodhisattva mahasattva who intentionally

analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po dag tu dong zhing sems can dmyal ba chen po'i sdug bsngal zhi bar byas nas /

translated: With those three miracles‚Äîthe miracle of psychic power, the miracle of reading the thoughts of others, and the miracle of instruction‚Äîthey teach the Dharma to the beings in the hells.

translated: And after they have risen up from those great hells, they are reborn in the same situation as gods and humans, and gradually put an end to suffering by means of the three vehicles.

translated: With the miracle of reading the minds of others and the miracle of instruction they teach the Dharma, and those bodhisattva great beings teach the Dharma with great love, great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity.

original: rab 'byor 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, what is the mundane gift of the Dharma?

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams brjod pa dang / bshad pa dang / ma nor bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams brjod pa dang / bshad pa dang / ma nor bar bstan pa ste /

original: 'di ltar mi gcang ba'i rnam pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshangs pa'i rnam par spyod pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang / gzhan yang 'jig rten pa'i chos byis pa so so'i skye bo dag dang thun mong du gyur pa rnams te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi gcang ba'i rnam pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshangs pa'i rnam par spyod pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang / gzhan yang 'jig rten pa'i chos byis pa so so'i skye bo dag dang thun mong du gyur pa rnams te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the four absorptions, the four formless states, the five clairvoyances, and other mundane dharmas that are shared in common with ordinary foolish beings.

original: rab 'byor de ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa'o //
translated: Subh≈´ti, this is the gift of mundane dharmas.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa de btang nas rnam grangs du mas 'jig rten gyi chos rnams ma nor bar blangs pa de las bskyod de /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa de btang nas rnam grangs du mas 'jig rten gyi chos rnams ma nor bar blangs pa de las bskyod de /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, having given that gift of mundane dharmas, bodhisattva great beings, by many ways, cause them to turn away from those mundane dharmas that they have not taken up without error.

original: de dag las bskyod nas /
analyzed: de dag las bskyod nas /
translated: Having caused them to turn away from those,

analyzed: thabs mkhas pas 'phags pa'i chos rnams dang / 'phags pa'i chos kyi 'bras bu dag la rab tu 'god do //
translated: they skillfully establish them in the noble dharmas and the fruits of the noble dharmas.

original: de la 'phags pa'i chos rnams ni gang /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i chos rnams ni gang /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat are the noble dharmas?

original: 'phags pa'i chos kyi 'bras bu ni gang zhe na 'phags pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum mo //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos kyi 'bras bu ni gang zhe na 'phags pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum mo //
translated: What is the fruit of the noble dharmas? The noble dharmas are the thirty-seven factors of awakening and the three gates of liberation.

original: 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi 'bras bu ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang ; phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi 'bras bu ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang ; phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid de /
translated: The fruit of the noble dharmas is the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, and arhatship.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa'i chos ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu shes pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa'i chos ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu shes pa'o //
translated: Subh≈´ti, the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva‚Äôs noble dharmas are the knowledge of the fruit of entering the stream.

analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu shes pa'o // phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu shes pa'o ;
translated: They are the knowledge of the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth.üîΩThey are the knowledge of the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth.

original: / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu nyid shes pa'o //
analyzed: / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu nyid shes pa'o //
translated: They are the knowledge of arhatship.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa shes pa'o //
translated: They are the knowledge of the perfection of generosity.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shes pa'o //
translated: They are the knowledge of the perfection of moral discipline.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa @235a * //
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa @235a * //
translated: the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration,

original: dang ; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: dang ; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shes pa'o //
translated: and the perfection of wisdom.

original: nang stong pa nyid shes pa'o //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of inner emptiness.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du shes pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, the emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of the compounded, the emptiness of the uncompounded, the emptiness of what is beyond extremes, the emptiness of the beginningless and endless, the emptiness of non-discarded, the emptiness of essential nature, and the emptiness of all things.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun shes pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
translated: It is the knowledge of the four noble truths, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams shes pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams shes pa'o //
translated: signlessness, and aspirationlessness, and the knowledge of the clairvoyances.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams shes pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ gateways and the meditative stabilities.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad shes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the ten powers of the Tathagata, the four grounds of self-confidence, the four analytical knowledges, and the eighteen special qualities of the Buddhas.

original: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po dang / btang snyoms chen po shes pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po dang / btang snyoms chen po shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of great love, great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity.

original: gzhan yang 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams shes pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams shes pa ste /
translated: It is the knowledge of mundane and supramundane dharmas, of contaminated and uncontaminated dharmas, of conditioned and unconditioned dharmas.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes ma gtogs par de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'phags pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes ma gtogs par de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'phags pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: Except for the knowledge of a knower of all aspects, these are the noble dharmas of a Bodhisattva-Mahasattva.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi 'bras bu gang zhe na /

analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spong pa ste /

analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi 'bras bu'o //

analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Subh≈´ti said to the Lord:

analyzed: de de bzhin te / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la bye brag ni ci zhig mchis /
translated: What is the difference between a bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva and a tathƒÅgata?‚Äù

analyzed: gsol pa / bye brag ni ji lta bu zhig mchis /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ye shes brnyes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: A tathƒÅgata is said to have attained gnosis.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi thugs kyang gzhan zhes bya ba med do //
translated: There is no other mind of a tathƒÅgata, a worthy one, a perfectly complete buddha.‚Äù

analyzed: rab 'byor de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa ste /

analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can rnams 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa la sbyor zhing thabs mkhas pas 'phags pa'i chos 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa la bkod nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, bodhisattva great beings thus connect beings to the mundane Dharma giving and, with skillful means, having established them in the supramundane Dharma giving of the noble ones, establish them in the knowledge of all aspects.

analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: smon nas shes pa dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / yongs su dag pa bzhi dang / dbang bcu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa @236a * //
translated: the cognition through aspiration, the six superknowledges, the four purities, the ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of precise knowledge,

translated: great compassion, the knowledge of all aspects, the thirty-two major marks of a great person, the eighty minor marks, the five hundred dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ doors, and the meditative stabilization doors.

translated: He practices without grasping at anything in the world.

original: nang gi tshor ba dang / phyi'i tshor ba dang / phyi nang gi tshor ba dang / nang gi sems dang / phyi'i sems dang / phyi nang gi sems dang / nang gi chos dang / phyi'i chos dang / phyi nang gi chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing brtson 'grus can shes bzhin dang ldan pa dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang yid mi bde ba rnam par spyod do //
analyzed: nang gi tshor ba dang / phyi'i tshor ba dang / phyi nang gi tshor ba dang / nang gi sems dang / phyi'i sems dang / phyi nang gi sems dang / nang gi chos dang / phyi'i chos dang / phyi nang gi chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing brtson 'grus can shes bzhin dang ldan pa dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang yid mi bde ba rnam par spyod do //
translated: He practices observing inner feelings, outer feelings, and inner and outer feelings. He practices observing inner mind, outer mind, and inner and outer mind. He practices observing inner dharmas, outer dharmas, and inner and outer dharmas. He practices with vigor, with mindfulness, and with introspection, and he does not get involved with the world‚Äôs worries and anxieties.

original: chos la kun 'byung ba'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do //
analyzed: chos la kun 'byung ba'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do //
translated: He practices observing the arising of dharmas.

original: chos la zad pa med pa'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do //
analyzed: chos la zad pa med pa'i rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod do //
translated: He practices observing the cessation of dharmas.

original: chos la mi gnas par rnam par spyod cing 'jig rten du gang yang nye bar len pa med do //
analyzed: chos la mi gnas par rnam par spyod cing 'jig rten du gang yang nye bar len pa med do //
translated: He practices without taking anything from the world.

original: rab 'byor yang dag par spong ba bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor yang dag par spong ba bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, what are the four right efforts?

original: sdig to mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir mos pa bskyed pa dang / skyes pa rnam par spang ba'i phyir rtsol ba dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir mos pa bskyed cing brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang /
analyzed: sdig to mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir mos pa bskyed pa dang / skyes pa rnam par spang ba'i phyir rtsol ba dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir mos pa bskyed cing brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang /
translated: They are:üîΩinterest in preventing the arising of nonvirtuous factors that have not yet arisen,üîΩeffort in eliminating those that have arisen,üîΩinterest in giving rise to virtuous factors that have not yet arisen, andüîΩthe effort to give rise to them.

original: skyes pa rnams shin tu 'phel zhing shin tu rgyas par bya ba dang / sgom pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir mos pa bskyed @236b pa'o ;
analyzed: skyes pa rnams shin tu 'phel zhing shin tu rgyas par bya ba dang / sgom pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir mos pa bskyed @236b pa'o ;
translated: It is the will to prevent the arising of evil, unwholesome states that have not yet arisen, the effort to abandon those that have arisen, the will to give rise to wholesome states that have not yet arisen, and the effort to increase and fully perfect those that have arisen.

original: / rab 'byor rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: / rab 'byor rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúSu¬≠bh≈´ti, what are the four supports for miraculous abilities?

original: mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / sems dang / brtson 'grus dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / sems dang / brtson 'grus dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //
translated: They are the support for miraculous abilities that is endowed with the meditative stability of aspiration and the formative force of exertion, the support for miraculous abilities that is endowed with the meditative stability of mind and the formative force of exertion, the support for miraculous abilities that is endowed with the meditative stability of diligence and the formative force of exertion, and the support for miraculous abilities that is endowed with the meditative stability of investigation and the formative force of exertion.

original: rab 'byor dbang po lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor dbang po lnga gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúSu¬≠bh≈´ti, what are the five powers?

original: dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po dang / de dag ni dbang po lnga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po dang / de dag ni dbang po lnga zhes bya'o //
translated: the faculty of faith, the faculty of perseverance, the faculty of mindfulness, the faculty of concentration, and the faculty of wisdom.

original: stobs lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: stobs lnga gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat are the five powers?

original: dad pa'i stobs dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / dran pa'i stobs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang / shes rab kyi stobs dang / de dag ni stobs lnga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dad pa'i stobs dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / dran pa'i stobs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang / shes rab kyi stobs dang / de dag ni stobs lnga zhes bya'o //
translated: They are the power of faith, the power of perseverance, the power of mindfulness, the power of concentration, and the power of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat are the seven aspects of awakening, Subh≈´ti?

original: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
analyzed: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
translated: They are the aspect of awakening of mindfulness, the aspect of awakening of the investigation of phenomena, the aspect of awakening of perseverance, the aspect of awakening of joy, the aspect of awakening of agility,

original: ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ste /
translated: the limb of enlightenment that is right concentration, and the limb of enlightenment that is right equanimity.

original: de dag ni byang chub kyi yan lag bdun zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni byang chub kyi yan lag bdun zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the seven limbs of enlightenment.

original: rab 'byor 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, what is the noble eightfold path?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
translated: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness,

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: and right concentration.

original: de dag ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ces bya'o //
translated: These are called the eight limbs of the noble path.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin gsum gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat are the three concentrations?

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: They are the concentration on emptiness, the concentration on wishlessness, and the concentration on signlessness.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samadhi of emptiness?

original: stong pa'i rnam pa dang / dben pa'i rnam par sems rtse gcig pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa'i rnam pa dang / dben pa'i rnam par sems rtse gcig pa ste /
translated: It is one-pointedness of mind in the aspect of emptiness and the aspect of isolation.

original: de ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the samadhi of emptiness.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samadhi of signlessness?

original: zhi ba'i rnam pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par sems rtse gcig pa ste /
analyzed: zhi ba'i rnam pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par sems rtse gcig pa ste /
translated: It is one-pointedness of mind in the aspect of peace and the aspect of signlessness.

original: de ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the samadhi of signlessness.

original: smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /üîΩmi rtag pa'i rnam pa dang / sdug bsngal @237a * //
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na / mi rtag pa'i rnam pa dang / sdug bsngal @237a * //
translated: What is the samadhi of wishlessness?

original: ba'i rnam par sems rtse gcig pa ste /
analyzed: ba'i rnam par sems rtse gcig pa ste /
translated: It is one-pointedness of mind in the aspect of impermanence and the aspect of suffering.

original: de ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the samadhi of wishlessness.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight liberations?

original: gzugs can gyi gzugs rnams mthong ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
analyzed: gzugs can gyi gzugs rnams mthong ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
translated: The perception of form when having form is the first liberation.

original: nang gzugs med pa'i 'du shes dang ldan pas phyi rol gyi gzugs thams cad mthong ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: nang gzugs med pa'i 'du shes dang ldan pas phyi rol gyi gzugs thams cad mthong ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second liberation is for one who has the perception of the internal body as formless to see all external forms.

original: bzang bar mos pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: bzang bar mos pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa gsum pa'o //
translated: The third liberation is for one who has the perception of the internal body as formless to see beautiful forms.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth liberation is to attain and abide in the sphere of infinite space.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifth liberation is to attain and abide in the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: cung zad med pa'i skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa drug pa'o //
analyzed: cung zad med pa'i skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa drug pa'o //
translated: The sixth liberation is to attain and abide in the sphere of nothingness.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa bdun pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa bdun pa'o //
translated: The seventh liberation is to attain and abide in the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa brgyad pa ste /
translated: The eighth liberation is to attain and abide in the cessation of perception and feeling.

original: de dag rnam par thar pa brgyad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag rnam par thar pa brgyad ces bya'o //
translated: These are called the eight liberations.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu gang zhe na /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the nine serial steps of meditative absorption?

original: 'di la la 'dod pas dben sdig to mi dge ba'i chos kyi dben pa /üîΩrtog pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: 'di la la 'dod pas dben sdig to mi dge ba'i chos kyi dben pa / rtog pa dang bcas pa /
translated: Here, someone, secluded from desires and secluded from negative and nonvirtuous factors,

original: dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
translated: with a mind imbued with applied and sustained thought,

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can /
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can /
translated: and with rapture and happiness born of seclusion,

original: bsam gtan dang po la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //üîΩrnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa nye bar zhi nas nang yongs su dang ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so // rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa nye bar zhi nas nang yongs su dang ste /
translated: dwells having attained the first meditative concentration.

original: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa /
translated: With the calming of applied and sustained thought, and with inward clarity and mental one-pointedness born of concentration, without applied and sustained thought,

original: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can /
translated: with rapture and happiness born of concentration,

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: he dwells having attained the second meditative concentration.

original: de dga' ba las 'dod chags dang bral bas dran pa dang ldan zhing shes bzhin du btang snyoms su gnas te /
analyzed: de dga' ba las 'dod chags dang bral bas dran pa dang ldan zhing shes bzhin du btang snyoms su gnas te /
translated: With the fading away of rapture, he dwells in equanimity, mindful and clearly knowing, experiencing happiness with the body,üîΩof which the noble ones declare: ‚ÄúHe who has equanimity and mindfulness dwells happily.‚Äù

original: bde ba lus kyis myong la 'phags pa rnams kyis dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba las rnam par spyod pa btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba lus kyis myong la 'phags pa rnams kyis dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba las rnam par spyod pa btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa ste /
translated: The noble ones describe it as a state of equanimity that is accompanied by mindfulness and that experiences bliss with the body.

original: dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //üîΩde bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal ba yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba snga nas kyang nub pas bde ba yang med sdug bsngal ba yang med pa btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so // de bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal ba yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba snga nas kyang nub pas bde ba yang med sdug bsngal ba yang med pa btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa /
translated: He then achieves and remains in the third meditative concentration, which is without joy.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa @237b la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //üîΩde rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa @237b la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so // de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: He abandons both pleasure and pain, as well as mental pleasure and mental displeasure. Thus, he achieves and remains in the fourth meditative concentration, which is a state of neither pleasure nor pain and is accompanied by equanimity and mindfulness.üîΩHe completely transcends all perceptions of form.

original: thags pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing /üîΩsna tshogs kyi 'du shes yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so zhes /
analyzed: thags pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing / sna tshogs kyi 'du shes yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so zhes /
translated: The perceptions of obstruction and the perceptions of individual forms disappear.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He does not pay attention to the perception of variety. Thus, he achieves and remains in the sphere of endless space.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: Having completely transcended the sphere of infinite space,

original: rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so zhes rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so zhes rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: he achieves and remains in the sphere of infinite consciousness, thinking, ‚ÄòConsciousness is infinite.‚Äô

original: de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: Having completely transcended the sphere of infinite consciousness,

original: cung zad ma yod do zhes cung zad med pa'i skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: cung zad ma yod do zhes cung zad med pa'i skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: he achieves and remains in the sphere of nothing whatsoever, thinking, ‚ÄòThere is nothing whatsoever.‚Äô

original: de rnam pa thams cad du cung zad med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du cung zad med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: Having completely transcended the sphere of nothing whatsoever,

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: he achieves and remains in the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: Having completely transcended the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception,

original: 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa la nye ba bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa la nye ba bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: he achieves and remains in the cessation of perception and feeling.

original: 'di ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the nine successive abodes of meditative absorption.

original: de la zad par gyi skye ma mched bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la zad par gyi skye ma mched bcu gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat are the ten universal spheres of perception?

original: zad par sa dang / zad par chu dang / zad par mi dang / zad par rlung dang / zad par spon po dang / zad par ser po dang / zad par dmar po dang / zad par dkar po dang / zad par rnam par shes pa dang /üîΩzad par nam mkha' ste /
analyzed: zad par sa dang / zad par chu dang / zad par mi dang / zad par rlung dang / zad par spon po dang / zad par ser po dang / zad par dmar po dang / zad par dkar po dang / zad par rnam par shes pa dang / zad par nam mkha' ste /
translated: They are the universal sphere of perception of earth, the universal sphere of perception of water, the universal sphere of perception of fire, the universal sphere of perception of wind, the universal sphere of perception of blue, the universal sphere of perception of yellow, the universal sphere of perception of red, the universal sphere of perception of white, the universal sphere of perception of space, and the universal sphere of perception of consciousness.

original: de dag ni zad par gyi skye mched bcu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni zad par gyi skye mched bcu zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the ten universal spheres of perception.

original: de la zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad gang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad gang gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat are the eight spheres of mastery?

original: nang gzugs su 'du shes shing phyi rol gyi gzugs phra mo dang / kha dog sdug pa dang / kha dog mi sdug pa mthong yang gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan te shes /
analyzed: nang gzugs su 'du shes shing phyi rol gyi gzugs phra mo dang / kha dog sdug pa dang / kha dog mi sdug pa mthong yang gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan te shes /
translated: While perceiving forms internally, one sees small external forms, both beautiful and ugly. One perceives and knows those forms having mastered and subdued them.

original: zil gyis mnan te mthong zhing /
analyzed: zil gyis mnan te mthong zhing /
translated: One sees and perceives them in this way.

original: de ltar 'du shes pa de ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang po'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'du shes pa de ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang po'o //
translated: This is the first sphere of mastery.

original: nang gzugs su 'du shes shing phyi rol gyi gzugs rags pa dang / kha dog sdug pa dang / kha dog mi sdug pa mthong yang gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan te shes /
analyzed: nang gzugs su 'du shes shing phyi rol gyi gzugs rags pa dang / kha dog sdug pa dang / kha dog mi sdug pa mthong yang gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan te shes /
translated: Perceiving no form internally, one sees external forms that are red, of red color, of red luster.

original: zil gyis mnan te mthong zhing de ltar 'du shes pa de ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched gnyis pa'o //
