original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams rnam par spyod pa sems can pha rol dang gang zag pha rol gyi nyon mongs pa mi skye ba'i mthu yod pa ting nge 'dzin gang gis 'grub pa de ni nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams rnam par spyod pa sems can pha rol dang gang zag pha rol gyi nyon mongs pa mi skye ba'i mthu yod pa ting nge 'dzin gang gis 'grub pa de ni nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The concentration that enables bodhisattvas to have the power not to produce the defilements of other sentient beings and other persons is called the concentration of the absence of defilements.

original: smon lam gyi shes pa gar zhe na /üîΩbsam gtan la gnas te 'di shes par bya'o zhes byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dus gsum gyi shes bya'am /
analyzed: smon lam gyi shes pa gar zhe na / bsam gtan la gnas te 'di shes par bya'o zhes byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dus gsum gyi shes bya'am /
translated: What is the knowledge resulting from a resolve?üîΩThe bodhisattva who is established in the trances and who wishes to know this or that object of knowledge or this or that knowledge of the three times,üîΩmakes a mental resolve:

original: shes pa gang dang gang 'dod par 'gyur pa de la yid kyis smon par byed de /
analyzed: shes pa gang dang gang 'dod par 'gyur pa de la yid kyis smon par byed de /
translated: ‚ÄúMay I know this object of knowledge or this knowledge of the three times!‚Äù

original: ting nge 'dzin de las langs nas de'i smon lam de yongs su grub par gyur cing shes bya de'ang shes pa de ni smon lam gyi shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de las langs nas de'i smon lam de yongs su grub par gyur cing shes bya de'ang shes pa de ni smon lam gyi shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When he has risen from that concentration, his resolve is fulfilled and he knows that object of knowledge. This is called the knowledge resulting from a resolve.

original: de la mngon par shes pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mngon par shes pa drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six superknowledges?

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa dang /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa dang /
translated: the superknowledge of magical power, the superknowledge of the divine eye, the superknowledge of the divine ear, the superknowledge of knowing the minds of others, the superknowledge of recollecting former lives,

original: zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa ste drug po de dag go //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa ste drug po de dag go //
translated: and the superknowledge of the extinction of the impurities.

original: de la yongs su dag pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yongs su dag pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat are the four purities?

original: lus yongs su dag pa dang / dmigs pa yongs su dag pa dang / sems yongs su dag pa dang / ye shes yongs su dag pa ste bzhi po de dag go //
analyzed: lus yongs su dag pa dang / dmigs pa yongs su dag pa dang / sems yongs su dag pa dang / ye shes yongs su dag pa ste bzhi po de dag go //
translated: The purity of body, the purity of object, the purity of mind, and the purity of knowledge.

original: de la dbang bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dbang bcu gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat are the ten masteries?

original: tshe la dbang ba dang / sems la dbang ba dang / yo byad la dbang ba dang / las la dbang ba dang / skye ba la dbang ba dang / mos pa la dbang ba dang / smon lam la dbang ba dang / rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba dang /
analyzed: tshe la dbang ba dang / sems la dbang ba dang / yo byad la dbang ba dang / las la dbang ba dang / skye ba la dbang ba dang / mos pa la dbang ba dang / smon lam la dbang ba dang / rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba dang /
translated: The mastery of life, the mastery of mind, the mastery of requisites, the mastery of action, the mastery of birth, the mastery of aspiration, the mastery of superknowledge, the mastery of the Dharma, the mastery of the truth, and the mastery of the wheel.

original: ye shes la dbang ba dang / chos la dbang ba ste /üîΩbcu po de dag go //
analyzed: ye shes la dbang ba dang / chos la dbang ba ste / bcu po de dag go //
translated: the power of knowledge of the possible and impossible,üîΩthe power of knowledge of the absorptions, liberations, concentrations, and attainments,üîΩand the power of knowledge of the recollection of former existences.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, what are the ten tathƒÅgata powers?

original: rab 'byor 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa ni gnas la yang gnas su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //üîΩgnas ma yin pa la yang gnas ma yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //üîΩ'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i las dang las yongs su @239a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa ni gnas la yang gnas su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to // gnas ma yin pa la yang gnas ma yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to // 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i las dang las yongs su @239a * //
translated: Subh≈´ti, here the tathƒÅgatas know, as it really is, what is the case to be the case and what is not the case to be not the case.

original: blangs pa'i rnam par smin pa gnas kyi rnam pa dang rgyu'i rnam par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: blangs pa'i rnam par smin pa gnas kyi rnam pa dang rgyu'i rnam par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: They know, as it really is, the result of the undertaking of actions in the past, future, and present in terms of the basis, the object, the ripening, and the cause.

original: khams sna tshogs can dang khams du ma can gyi 'jig rten yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: khams sna tshogs can dang khams du ma can gyi 'jig rten yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: They know, as it really is, the world with its many and various compositional elements.

original: sems can gzhan dang gang zag gzhan gyi mos pa sna tshogs dang mos pa du ma yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: sems can gzhan dang gang zag gzhan gyi mos pa sna tshogs dang mos pa du ma yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the various and numerous aspirations of other beings and individuals just as they are.

original: sems can gzhan dang gang zag gzhan gyi dbang po rab dang tha ma shes par bya ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: sems can gzhan dang gang zag gzhan gyi dbang po rab dang tha ma shes par bya ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the higher and lower faculties of other beings and individuals just as they are.

original: kun du 'gro ba'i lam yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba'i lam yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the paths that lead everywhere just as they are.

original: dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba rnam par dgod pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba rnam par dgod pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the arrangement of the faculties, powers, aspects of awakening, concentrations, liberations, meditative stabilizations, and absorptions, as well as the afflictions and purification, just as they are.

original: rnam pa du mar sngon gyi gnas rjes su dgongs te /
analyzed: rnam pa du mar sngon gyi gnas rjes su dgongs te /
translated: He recollects his many previous lives.

original: tshe rabs gcig kyang rjes su dgongs pa nas /
analyzed: tshe rabs gcig kyang rjes su dgongs pa nas /
translated: He recollects one lifetime,

original: tshe rabs brgya dang / tshe rabs stong dang / tshe rabs brgya stong dang / tshe rabs bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi bar du yang rjes su dgongs te /üîΩbskal pa gcig kyang rjes su dgongs pa nas /
analyzed: tshe rabs brgya dang / tshe rabs stong dang / tshe rabs brgya stong dang / tshe rabs bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi bar du yang rjes su dgongs te / bskal pa gcig kyang rjes su dgongs pa nas /
translated: He recollects one hundred lifetimes, one thousand lifetimes, one hundred thousand lifetimes, up to many quintillions of lifetimes.üîΩHe recollects one eon, up to many quintillions of eons.

original: bskal pa brgya'i bar dang / bskal pa brgya phrag du ma dang / bskal pa brgya stong phrag du ma dang / bskal ba bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma'i bar dag kyang rjes su dgongs te /
analyzed: bskal pa brgya'i bar dang / bskal pa brgya phrag du ma dang / bskal pa brgya stong phrag du ma dang / bskal ba bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma'i bar dag kyang rjes su dgongs te /
translated: He recollects one hundred eons, up to many quintillions of eons.

original: bdag ni 'di lta bu zhig na 'dug 'dug go //
analyzed: bdag ni 'di lta bu zhig na 'dug 'dug go //
translated: He recollects, ‚ÄòI was born in such and such a place.

original: ming ni 'di zhes bya bar gyur to //
analyzed: ming ni 'di zhes bya bar gyur to //
translated: My name was such and such.

original: rigs kyi 'di zhes bya bar gyur to //üîΩrus ni 'di zhes bya bar gyur to //
analyzed: rigs kyi 'di zhes bya bar gyur to // rus ni 'di zhes bya bar gyur to //
translated: I was of such and such a caste.

original: zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za'o //üîΩyun ni 'di srid cig tu gnas gnas so //
analyzed: zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za'o // yun ni 'di srid cig tu gnas gnas so //
translated: I ate such and such food.üîΩI experienced such and such happiness and suffering.

original: tshe'i mtha' ni 'di tsam zhig tu gyur te /
analyzed: tshe'i mtha' ni 'di tsam zhig tu gyur te /
translated: My life span was such and such.

original: bdag de nas shi 'phos nas che ge mo zhig tu skyes so zhes bya ba nas /üîΩde nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes so zhes bya ba'i bar du rnam pa dang bcas /üîΩsa mal dang bcas /

original: thugs yeng yeng por mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: thugs yeng yeng por mi 'gyur te /
translated: nor is his mind distracted.

original: 'di ni dgongs pa nye bar gzhag pa dang po'o //üîΩla la rna ba btud de rim gror nyan zhing bka' @241a * //
analyzed: 'di ni dgongs pa nye bar gzhag pa dang po'o // la la rna ba btud de rim gror nyan zhing bka' @241a * //
translated: This is the first intention.üîΩSome people do not listen with their ears attentive, and do not set their minds on obeying his words,

original: nyan pa'i sems nye bar gzhog pa med pa dang / chos dang gnyer ba'i chos nan tan du mi byed na yang des de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs khro bar mi 'gyur /üîΩmi bzod par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: nyan pa'i sems nye bar gzhog pa med pa dang / chos dang gnyer ba'i chos nan tan du mi byed na yang des de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs khro bar mi 'gyur / mi bzod par mi 'gyur /
translated: but even if they do practice the Dharma and apply themselves to the teachings, the TathƒÅgata is not displeased by that,üîΩnor is he impatient,

original: thugs mi ches par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: thugs mi ches par mi 'gyur te /
translated: nor is his mind unconvinced.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa nye bar gzhag pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa nye bar gzhag pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second point of intention of the TathƒÅgata.

original: la la rna ba btud de rim gror nyan zhing bka' mnyan pa'i sems nye bar gzhog la chos dang gnyer ba'i chos la nan tan du byed /üîΩla la rna ba btud de rim gror mi byed cing /
analyzed: la la rna ba btud de rim gror nyan zhing bka' mnyan pa'i sems nye bar gzhog la chos dang gnyer ba'i chos la nan tan du byed / la la rna ba btud de rim gror mi byed cing /
translated: Some people listen with their ears attentive, with a mind to receive the teaching, and they practice the Dharma that they have sought.

original: bka' mnyan pa'i sems nye bar gzhog pa med pa ste /
analyzed: bka' mnyan pa'i sems nye bar gzhog pa med pa ste /
translated: Some people listen with their ears attentive, but they do not have a mind to receive the teaching,

original: chos dang gnyer ba'i chos nan tan du mi byed kyang /üîΩdes de bzhin gshegs pa dgyes pa'am /
analyzed: chos dang gnyer ba'i chos nan tan du mi byed kyang / des de bzhin gshegs pa dgyes pa'am /
translated: and they do not practice the Dharma that they have sought.

original: thugs khro bar gnyis su mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: thugs khro bar gnyis su mi 'gyur te /
translated: But the TathƒÅgata does not become pleased or displeased by this.

original: thams cad du dgongs pa dang ldan zhing mkhyen par btang snyoms su rnam par spyod pa 'di ni dgongs pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad du dgongs pa dang ldan zhing mkhyen par btang snyoms su rnam par spyod pa 'di ni dgongs pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum pa'o //
translated: He is always attentive, and he acts with equanimity and knowledge. This is the third point of intention.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyams pa med pa'i chos nyid gang zhe na /üîΩgang gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams don yod pa'i chos ston pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyams pa med pa'i chos nyid gang zhe na /üîΩgang gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams don yod pa'i chos ston pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs nature of being without error?üîΩThe TathƒÅgata‚Äôs speech is not meaningless.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad pa la dus las mi 'da' ba ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad pa la dus las mi 'da' ba ste /
translated: He never misses the time for acting for the welfare of all sentient beings.

original: de ni nyams pa med pa'i chos nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni nyams pa med pa'i chos nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the ‚Äúreality of non-deficiency.‚Äù

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i bag chags kyi sgrib pa rab tu spangs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i bag chags kyi sgrib pa rab tu spangs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs elimination of the obscurations of the latent tendencies?

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad ni nyon mongs pa spangs kyang lus kyi 'gyur ba yod kyi /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad ni nyon mongs pa spangs kyang lus kyi 'gyur ba yod kyi /
translated: Even though all the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas have eliminated the afflictions, they still have physical changes.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni de lta bu yang mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni de lta bu yang mi mnga' ste /
translated: But the TathƒÅgata has none of that.

original: de ni bag chags kyi sgrib pa rab tu spangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni bag chags kyi sgrib pa rab tu spangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the ‚Äúelimination of the obscurations of the latent tendencies.‚Äù

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs great compassion?üîΩThe TathƒÅgata‚Äôs great compassion is the great compassion that is endowed with the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs own qualities, which is not shared in common with the disciples and solitary buddhas, and which is the cause for the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs not abandoning sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po gang dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi brda nye bar bzung ste /üîΩdge ba'i rtsa ba gzigs pa'i phyir dus thams cad du 'jig rten la nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du rtog pa mdzad ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po gang dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi brda nye bar bzung ste /üîΩdge ba'i rtsa ba gzigs pa'i phyir dus thams cad du 'jig rten la nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du rtog pa mdzad ces bya ba ste /
translated: The TathƒÅgata‚Äôs great compassion is the great compassion that is endowed with the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs own qualities, which is not shared in common with the disciples and solitary buddhas, and which is the cause for the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs not abandoning sentient beings.

original: dngos su na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs rje chen po sems can mtha' yas pa yongs su smin par bya ba la gzigs pa rtag par 'byung ste /
analyzed: dngos su na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs rje chen po sems can mtha' yas pa yongs su smin par bya ba la gzigs pa rtag par 'byung ste /
translated: In reality, the great compassion of the Blessed Buddhas, which is directed toward the maturation of infinite sentient beings, is always present.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the great compassion of the TathƒÅgatas.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, what are the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs eighteen distinctive qualities of a buddha?

original: de bzhin @241b gshegs pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga'o //üîΩca co mi mnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin @241b gshegs pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga'o // ca co mi mnga'o //
translated: The TathƒÅgata has no error.üîΩHe has no incoherence.

original: dgongs pa nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He has no loss of recollection.

original: 'du shes sna tshogs mi mnga'o //üîΩthugs mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: 'du shes sna tshogs mi mnga'o // thugs mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He has no diverse thoughts.üîΩHe has no lack of meditative concentration.

original: so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga'o //üîΩmos pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' //
analyzed: so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga'o // mos pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' //
translated: He has no lack of discernment.üîΩHe has no loss of aspiration.

original: brtson 'grus yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //üîΩdran pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o // dran pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He has no loss of effort.üîΩHe has no loss of mindfulness.

original: ting nge 'dzin yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He has no loss of meditative concentration.

original: shes rab yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: shes rab yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not have any loss of wisdom.

original: rnam par grol ba yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not have any loss of liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gzigs pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o ;
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gzigs pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o ;
translated: He does not have any loss of the vision of wisdom of liberation.

original: / sku'i phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ste /üîΩye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: / sku'i phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ste / ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: All his physical actions are preceded by wisdom and follow wisdom.

original: gsung gi phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ste /üîΩye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o //üîΩthugs kyi phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: gsung gi phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ste / ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o // thugs kyi phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ste /
translated: All his verbal actions are preceded by wisdom and follow wisdom.

original: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o //üîΩ'das pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug go //üîΩma 'ongs pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzugs pa 'jug go //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o // 'das pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug go // ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzugs pa 'jug go //
translated: All his mental actions are preceded by wisdom and follow wisdom.üîΩHis vision of wisdom is unimpeded and unobstructed with regard to the past.üîΩHis vision of wisdom is unimpeded and unobstructed with regard to the future.

original: de ltar byung ba'i du la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug ste /
analyzed: de ltar byung ba'i du la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug ste /
translated: His vision of wisdom is unimpeded and unobstructed with regard to the present.

original: de dang ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dang ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams so //
translated: and the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang zhe na /üîΩgang la dmigs pa med pa dran pas dbang bsgyur ba zhi ba'i rnam pa dang ldan pa mtshan nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya'o /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang zhe na / gang la dmigs pa med pa dran pas dbang bsgyur ba zhi ba'i rnam pa dang ldan pa mtshan nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya'o /
translated: Subh≈´ti, what is the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs knowledge of all aspects?

original: // / bam po drug cu bdun pa ;
analyzed: // / bam po drug cu bdun pa ;
translated: It is the knowledge of all aspects that is not an object of attention, is mastered by mindfulness, has the aspect of peace, and has the characteristic of the absence of characteristics.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: Subh≈´ti, what are the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs thirty-two major marks of a great person?

original: phyag dang zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa dang / zhabs shin tu gnas pa dang / phyag dang zhabs dra bas 'brel pa dang / phyag dang zhabs gzhon zhing 'jam pa dang / bdun shin tu mtho ba dang / sor mo ring ba dang /
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa dang / zhabs shin tu gnas pa dang / phyag dang zhabs dra bas 'brel pa dang / phyag dang zhabs gzhon zhing 'jam pa dang / bdun shin tu mtho ba dang / sor mo ring ba dang /
translated: They are: having feet with wheels, having feet that are well-placed, having webbed hands and feet, having soft and youthful hands and feet, having seven elevated areas, having long fingers,

original: rting pa yangs pa dang / sku che zhing drang ba dang / zhabs legs par mtho ba dang / yan lag gi spu gyen du 'khyil pa dang / ri dgas ae na ya'i byin pa lta bu dang / phyag brla drang por slebs pa dang /
analyzed: rting pa yangs pa dang / sku che zhing drang ba dang / zhabs legs par mtho ba dang / yan lag gi spu gyen du 'khyil pa dang / ri dgas ae na ya'i byin pa lta bu dang / phyag brla drang por slebs pa dang /
translated: the heels are broad, the body is tall and straight, the feet are well elevated, the body hair curls upward, the calves are like the deer of Ena, the hands reach the knees when outstretched,

original: gsang ba'i gnas sbubs su nub pa dang / gser gyi kha dog dang / @242a * //
analyzed: gsang ba'i gnas sbubs su nub pa dang / gser gyi kha dog dang / @242a * //
translated: the sexual organ is concealed in a sheath, the skin is golden colored,

original: mdog shin tu 'jam pa dang / spu re re nas g-yas phyogs su 'khyil pa dang / zhal mdzod spus brgyan pa dang / seng ge'i ro stod lta bu dang / phrag pa'i lhun mdzes par grub pa dang / phrag so shin tu rgyas pa dang /
analyzed: mdog shin tu 'jam pa dang / spu re re nas g-yas phyogs su 'khyil pa dang / zhal mdzod spus brgyan pa dang / seng ge'i ro stod lta bu dang / phrag pa'i lhun mdzes par grub pa dang / phrag so shin tu rgyas pa dang /
translated: the skin is very smooth, each body hair curls to the right, the face is adorned with a tuft of hair between the eyebrows, the torso is like a lion‚Äôs, the shoulders are beautifully formed, the shoulders are very broad,üîΩthe arms are long,

original: ro bro ba'i mchog dang / shing n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa dang / dbu spyi gtsug dang ldan pa dang / ljags shin tu yangs pa dang / tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang / seng ge'i 'gram pa lta bu dang / tshems shin tu dkar ba dang /
analyzed: ro bro ba'i mchog dang / shing n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa dang / dbu spyi gtsug dang ldan pa dang / ljags shin tu yangs pa dang / tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang / seng ge'i 'gram pa lta bu dang / tshems shin tu dkar ba dang /
translated: the cheeks like a lion,üîΩthe very white teeth,üîΩthe very even teeth,üîΩthe teeth without gaps,üîΩthe forty teeth with no more and no less,

original: tshems shin tu mnyam pa dang / tshems thags bzang ba dang / tshems mnyam zhing bzhi bcu tshang ba dang / spyan dkar nag 'byes pa dang / ba'i rdzi ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: tshems shin tu mnyam pa dang / tshems thags bzang ba dang / tshems mnyam zhing bzhi bcu tshang ba dang / spyan dkar nag 'byes pa dang / ba'i rdzi ma lta bu ste /
translated: the eyes with black and white parts distinct,üîΩand the eyelashes like a cow‚Äôs.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag dang zhabs kyi mthil la 'khor lo rtsibs stong dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag dang zhabs kyi mthil la 'khor lo rtsibs stong dang ldan pa /
translated: The TathƒÅgata has hands and feet with wheels with a thousand spokes,

original: mu khyud can lte ba dang bcas pa rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mu khyud can lte ba dang bcas pa rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: with rims and hubs, complete in every way,

original: rus pa'am / ba so la gzugs su brkos pa dang 'dra ba mnga' bas phyag dang zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldang pa'o //
analyzed: rus pa'am / ba so la gzugs su brkos pa dang 'dra ba mnga' bas phyag dang zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldang pa'o //
translated: like a wheel carved in relief on bone or ivory.

original: zhabs kyi mthil gnyis mnyam par sa la 'jog cing zhabs sum pa med pas zhabs shin tu gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhabs kyi mthil gnyis mnyam par sa la 'jog cing zhabs sum pa med pas zhabs shin tu gnas pa'o //
translated: His feet are placed evenly on the ground, and since he has no hollow feet, his feet are well-placed.

original: ngang pa'i rgyal po ltar phyag dang zhabs kyi sor mo ring bas 'brel pas phyag dang zhabs dra bas 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: ngang pa'i rgyal po ltar phyag dang zhabs kyi sor mo ring bas 'brel pas phyag dang zhabs dra bas 'brel ba'o //
translated: Since his fingers and toes are long like those of a king goose, he has long fingers and toes.

original: shing bal gyi sgo nga ltar shin tu 'jam zhing gzhon pas phyag dang zhabs gzhon zhing 'jam pa'o //
analyzed: shing bal gyi sgo nga ltar shin tu 'jam zhing gzhon pas phyag dang zhabs gzhon zhing 'jam pa'o //
translated: Since his hands and feet are very soft and tender like cotton down, he has soft and tender hands and feet.

original: phyag dang zhabs dang mgur gyi lhun shin tu mtho bas bdun shin tu mtho ba'o //
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs dang mgur gyi lhun shin tu mtho bas bdun shin tu mtho ba'o //
translated: Since his hands, feet, and neck are very full, he has seven prominent body parts.

original: phyag dang zhabs kyi sor mo ring bas sor mo ring ba'o //
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs kyi sor mo ring bas sor mo ring ba'o //
translated: Since his fingers and toes are long, he has long fingers and toes.

original: rting pa ring bas rting pa yangs pa'o //
analyzed: rting pa ring bas rting pa yangs pa'o //
translated: Since his heels are long, he has long heels.

original: sku khru bdun du 'phags la drang bas sku che zheng drang ba'o //
analyzed: sku khru bdun du 'phags la drang bas sku che zheng drang ba'o //
translated: Since his body is seven cubits tall and straight, he has a large and straight body.

original: bus mo'i lha da dang long bu mdzes par nub pas zhabs legs par mtho ba'o //
analyzed: bus mo'i lha da dang long bu mdzes par nub pas zhabs legs par mtho ba'o //
translated: Since his ankles and knees are beautiful and hidden, he has well-rounded feet.

original: spu gyen du g-yas phyogs su 'khyil pas yan lag gi spu gyen du 'khyil ba'o //
analyzed: spu gyen du g-yas phyogs su 'khyil pas yan lag gi spu gyen du 'khyil ba'o //
translated: Since his body hair curls to the right, his body hair curls to the right.

original: ri dgas ae na ya'i byin pa dang / smyig ma dang ldum bu dar ba ltar drang zhing ma nyams la rim gyis gzhol bar grub cing byin pa zlum pas ri dgas ae na ya'i byin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ri dgas ae na ya'i byin pa dang / smyig ma dang ldum bu dar ba ltar drang zhing ma nyams la rim gyis gzhol bar grub cing byin pa zlum pas ri dgas ae na ya'i byin pa lta bu'o //
translated: His legs are like those of the enaya deer, straight and without defects, gradually tapering, and rounded, like the enaya deer's legs.

original: brla drang por bzhag ste ma btud kyang phyag gi mthil gnyis kyis pus mo'i lha nga la reg pas phyag brla drang por slebs pa'o //
analyzed: brla drang por bzhag ste ma btud kyang phyag gi mthil gnyis kyis pus mo'i lha nga la reg pas phyag brla drang por slebs pa'o //
translated: His arms reach down to his knees when he stands without bending over.

original: glang po dang rta cang shes ltar gsang ba'i gnas shin tu mdzes shing sbubs su @242b nub pas gsang ba'i gnas sbubs su nub pa'o //
analyzed: glang po dang rta cang shes ltar gsang ba'i gnas shin tu mdzes shing sbubs su @242b nub pas gsang ba'i gnas sbubs su nub pa'o //
translated: His sexual organ is concealed in a sheath, like that of a thoroughbred horse or elephant.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa'i gser gyi kha dog lta bu dang ldan pas gser gyi kha dog go //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa'i gser gyi kha dog lta bu dang ldan pas gser gyi kha dog go //
translated: His skin has the color of gold from the Jambu River.

original: gser dang dngul shin tu sbyangs pa ltar 'jam zhing gzhon pa'i mdog tu 'dug la sku la rdul gyis mi 'go bas kha dag shin tu 'jam pa'o //
analyzed: gser dang dngul shin tu sbyangs pa ltar 'jam zhing gzhon pa'i mdog tu 'dug la sku la rdul gyis mi 'go bas kha dag shin tu 'jam pa'o //
translated: His skin is smooth and soft, like that of a young child or like the finest cotton cloth.

original: shin tu rnam par phye ba'i spu re rer skyes shing gnyis su med pas spu re re nas g-yas phyogs su 'khyil pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par phye ba'i spu re rer skyes shing gnyis su med pas spu re re nas g-yas phyogs su 'khyil pa'o //
translated: The hair grows singly and not in pairs, and each hair is very fine and curls to the right.

original: me tog kun da dang zla ba dang / 'o ma dang / ba mo'i mdog ltar 'dug pa nyi ma dang zla ba brgya las kyang 'phags par 'od gsal ba'i mdzod spus smin mtshams shin tu brgyan pas zhal mdzod spus brgyan pa'o ;
analyzed: me tog kun da dang zla ba dang / 'o ma dang / ba mo'i mdog ltar 'dug pa nyi ma dang zla ba brgya las kyang 'phags par 'od gsal ba'i mdzod spus smin mtshams shin tu brgyan pas zhal mdzod spus brgyan pa'o ;
translated: The hair between his eyebrows is very beautiful, like a jasmine flower, the moon, milk, or a conch shell, and shines with a light brighter than a hundred suns and moons.

original: / ro stod tshe bas seng ge'i ro stod do //
analyzed: / ro stod tshe bas seng ge'i ro stod do //
translated: His chest is broad like that of a lion.

original: mgur dang rgyud legs par 'brel zhing lhun zlum pas phrag pa'i lhun mdzes par grub pa'o //
analyzed: mgur dang rgyud legs par 'brel zhing lhun zlum pas phrag pa'i lhun mdzes par grub pa'o //
translated: His shoulders are well rounded and beautiful, because his throat and torso are well connected.

original: gser gyi gtan pa shin tu phyis pa la phrag so legs par grub pas phrag so shin tu legs par rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: gser gyi gtan pa shin tu phyis pa la phrag so legs par grub pas phrag so shin tu legs par rgyas pa'o //
translated: His shoulders are very broad, because his collar bones are well formed like well-polished gold plates.

original: rlung dang mkhris pa dang bde kan gyis ma nyams shing rnam par shes pa 'dra ba med pas ro bro ba'i mchog go //
analyzed: rlung dang mkhris pa dang bde kan gyis ma nyams shing rnam par shes pa 'dra ba med pas ro bro ba'i mchog go //
translated: His tongue is the most sensitive of all, because it is not damaged by wind, bile, or phlegm, and is not like the consciousness.

original: sku chu zheng 'dom du mnyam pas shing n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa'o //
analyzed: sku chu zheng 'dom du mnyam pas shing n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa'o //
translated: His body is the same in width and height, so it is like a banyan tree, with a width and height that are in proportion.

original: spyi gtsug zlum zhing legs la g-yas phyogs su 'khyil pa dang ldan pa'i dbu mnyam zhing legs par grub la mdzes pa mnga' bas dbu spyi gtsug dang ldan pa'o ;
analyzed: spyi gtsug zlum zhing legs la g-yas phyogs su 'khyil pa dang ldan pa'i dbu mnyam zhing legs par grub la mdzes pa mnga' bas dbu spyi gtsug dang ldan pa'o ;
translated: His head is round, well-formed, and has a crown protrusion, because it is well-formed, well-proportioned, and beautiful.

original: / me tog autpala dmar po'i 'dab ma'i mdog ltar 'dug cing shin tu yangs pas ljags shin tu yangs shing srab pa'o //
analyzed: / me tog autpala dmar po'i 'dab ma'i mdog ltar 'dug cing shin tu yangs pas ljags shin tu yangs shing srab pa'o //
translated: His tongue is very broad and slender, because it is the color of a red utpala petal and very broad.

original: tshangs pa dang bya ka la ping ka lta bu'i gsung mnga' bas tshangs pa'i dbyangs so //
analyzed: tshangs pa dang bya ka la ping ka lta bu'i gsung mnga' bas tshangs pa'i dbyangs so //
translated: He has the voice of Brahma, like Brahma and the kalavi·πÖka bird, because he has the voice of Brahma.

original: 'gram pa me long gi dkyil 'khor ltar legs par grub cing mdzes par skyes te /
analyzed: 'gram pa me long gi dkyil 'khor ltar legs par grub cing mdzes par skyes te /
translated: His cheeks are well-formed and beautiful, like the surface of a mirror.

original: yid du 'ong bas seng ge'i 'gram pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yid du 'ong bas seng ge'i 'gram pa lta bu'o //
translated: His cheeks are like a lion‚Äôs, because they are attractive.

original: me tog kun da dang dung gi bcag 'phro ltar shin tu dkar ba'i tshems mnga' bas tshems shin tu dkar ba'o //
analyzed: me tog kun da dang dung gi bcag 'phro ltar shin tu dkar ba'i tshems mnga' bas tshems shin tu dkar ba'o //
translated: His teeth are very white, because they are the color of jasmine and the white of a conch shell.

original: tshems la mtho dman med pas tshems mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: tshems la mtho dman med pas tshems mnyam pa'o //
translated: His teeth are even, because there is no high or low among them.

original: tshems la mtshams ma dod pas tshems thags bzang ba'o //
analyzed: tshems la mtshams ma dod pas tshems thags bzang ba'o //
translated: His teeth are well-spaced, because there are no gaps between them.

original: bla 'og dgye gu med pas tshems mnyam zhing bzhi bcu tshad ba'o //
analyzed: bla 'og dgye gu med pas tshems mnyam zhing bzhi bcu tshad ba'o //
translated: His teeth are forty in number, because there is no upper or lower jaw.

original: dkar nag gi cha ma 'dres la shin tu rnam par dag cing mdog dmar pos ma g-yogs pas spyan dkar nag 'byes pa'o //
analyzed: dkar nag gi cha ma 'dres la shin tu rnam par dag cing mdog dmar pos ma g-yogs pas spyan dkar nag 'byes pa'o //
translated: His eyes are deep blue, because the white and black parts of his eyes are very pure and unclouded by any red tinge.

original: rdzi ma bla 'og tu legs par gnas la ma 'dzing pas ba'i rdzi ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: rdzi ma bla 'og tu legs par gnas la ma 'dzing pas ba'i rdzi ma lta bu'o //
translated: His eyelashes are like those of a magnificent heifer, because his upper and lower eyelashes are well-placed and do not get mixed up.

original: de la bla ma la bsu skyel @243a * //
analyzed: de la bla ma la bsu skyel @243a * //
translated: Here, the wheel-marks on his hands and feet are due to his having welcomed and escorted gurus,üîΩlistened to the Dharma, and honored temples,

original: dang ; chos nyan ba la bstod pa dang / gtsug lag khang dan /üîΩmchod rten la sogs pa'i bsti stong byas pas phyag dang zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: dang ; chos nyan ba la bstod pa dang / gtsug lag khang dan / mchod rten la sogs pa'i bsti stong byas pas phyag dang zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa ste /
translated: stupas, and so on.

original: da ni 'khor shin tu mnga' ba'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: da ni 'khor shin tu mnga' ba'i snga ltas so //
translated: These are the signs of his having had an extremely large retinue.

original: yid dam la brtan pas zhabs shin tu gnas pa ste /
analyzed: yid dam la brtan pas zhabs shin tu gnas pa ste /
translated: His feet are well-planted, because he is firm in his commitments.

original: de ni mi g-yo zhing shin tu brtan pa'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: de ni mi g-yo zhing shin tu brtan pa'i snga ltas so //
translated: This is the sign of his being unshakable and extremely firm.

original: sbyin pa dang / ngag snyan pa dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pa'i bsdu ba rnam pa bzhi goms par byas pas /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / ngag snyan pa dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pa'i bsdu ba rnam pa bzhi goms par byas pas /
translated: By being accustomed to the four means of gathering disciples‚Äîgenerosity, pleasant speech, purposeful behavior, and practicing what one preaches‚Äî

original: phyag dang zhabs dra bas 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs dra bas 'brel pa ste /
translated: one has hands and feet with a weblike membrane.

original: de ni myur du 'du ba'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: de ni myur du 'du ba'i snga ltas so //
translated: This is an auspicious sign of quickly gathering disciples.

original: bza' ba dang bca' ba dang btung ba zhim zhing nyams su bde ba byin pas phyag dang zhabs gzhon zhing 'jam pa dang / bdun shin tu mtho ba ste /
analyzed: bza' ba dang bca' ba dang btung ba zhim zhing nyams su bde ba byin pas phyag dang zhabs gzhon zhing 'jam pa dang / bdun shin tu mtho ba ste /
translated: By giving delicious and nutritious food and drink, one has hands and feet that are soft and youthful, and one‚Äôs calves are like those of the e·πáeya antelope.

original: de gnyis ni bza' ba dang btung ba zhim zhing nyams su bde ba thob pa'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: de gnyis ni bza' ba dang btung ba zhim zhing nyams su bde ba thob pa'i snga ltas so //
translated: These two are auspicious signs of obtaining delicious and nutritious food and drink.

original: bcings pa bkrol ba dang / srog gi rim gro byas pa dang srog gcod pa spangs pas /
analyzed: bcings pa bkrol ba dang / srog gi rim gro byas pa dang srog gcod pa spangs pas /

analyzed: sor mo ring ba dang / rting pa yangs pa dang sku che zhing drang ba ste /

original: de ni sku tshe ring ba'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: de ni sku tshe ring ba'i snga ltas so //

original: dge ba'i chos yang dag par blangs pa dang bzung ba mngon par spel zhing 'grib par ma byas pas zhabs kyi gong mtho ba dang / yan lag gi spu gyen du 'khyil pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos yang dag par blangs pa dang bzung ba mngon par spel zhing 'grib par ma byas pas zhabs kyi gong mtho ba dang / yan lag gi spu gyen du 'khyil pa ste /

analyzed: de ni mi nyams pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i snga ltas so //
translated: These are the signs of his having the dharma of non-degeneration.

original: rig pa dang bzo'i las la rim gror byas shing gzhan la byin pa dang / bdag gis blangs pas ri dgas ae na ya'i byin pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: rig pa dang bzo'i las la rim gror byas shing gzhan la byin pa dang / bdag gis blangs pas ri dgas ae na ya'i byin pa lta bu ste /

analyzed: de ni myur du 'dzin pa'i snga ltas so //

analyzed: bdog cing yod pa'i nor la bslangs nas mi god par gtong zhig med ces ma byas pas phyag brla drang por slebs pa ste /

analyzed: de ni yo byad la dbang ba dang dul ba'i snga ltas so //
translated: These are the signs of his having the dharma of being disciplined and having control over his possessions.

original: 'grogs pa dang mdza' ba shes dang gnyen pa ma phye ba dang / dbyi bar gyur pa'i sems can rnams tshangs pa'i spyod pa la yang dag par bskul ba dang / gsad ba'i tshig yongs su bsrungs pas gsang ba'i gnas sbubs su nub pa ste /
analyzed: 'grogs pa dang mdza' ba shes dang gnyen pa ma phye ba dang / dbyi bar gyur pa'i sems can rnams tshangs pa'i spyod pa la yang dag par bskul ba dang / gsad ba'i tshig yongs su bsrungs pas gsang ba'i gnas sbubs su nub pa ste /
translated: He has not broken his friendships with those who are his friends, his acquaintances, his relatives, and his kinsmen. He has encouraged sentient beings to practice pure conduct. He has guarded against words that would cause others to be killed.

original: de ni bu mang ba'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: de ni bu mang ba'i snga ltas so //
translated: These are the signs of having many children.

original: stan dang gos dang khang pa dang gzhal med khang dang / gnas bzang po byin pas gser gyi kha dog dang mdog shin tu 'jam pa ste /
analyzed: stan dang gos dang khang pa dang gzhal med khang dang / gnas bzang po byin pas gser gyi kha dog dang mdog shin tu 'jam pa ste /

original: de gnyis ni gdan dang na bzang dang / khang pa dang gzhal med khang ngang gnas bzang po 'thob pa'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: de gnyis ni gdan dang na bzang dang / khang pa dang gzhal med khang ngang gnas bzang po 'thob pa'i snga ltas so //

original: 'du 'dzi spangs pa dang / mkhan @243b po dang / slob dpon dang / pha ma dang / phu nu la sogs pa bla ma rnams la tshul dang 'dra bar rim gro byas pa dang / btsun par byas pa dang / bsgo ba rnal ma gzan pas spu re re nas g-yas phyogs su 'khyil pa dang /
analyzed: 'du 'dzi spangs pa dang / mkhan @243b po dang / slob dpon dang / pha ma dang / phu nu la sogs pa bla ma rnams la tshul dang 'dra bar rim gro byas pa dang / btsun par byas pa dang / bsgo ba rnal ma gzan pas spu re re nas g-yas phyogs su 'khyil pa dang /
translated: He has served his gurus properly, with respect and obedience, including his preceptors, instructors, parents, and siblings, and so his body hair grows singly and curls to the right.

original: zhal mdzod spus brgyan pa ste /
analyzed: zhal mdzod spus brgyan pa ste /
translated: He has a face adorned with a ≈´r·πáƒÅ hair,

original: de ni mnyam pa med pa'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: de ni mnyam pa med pa'i snga ltas so //
translated: which is a sign of his unequaled nature.

original: mi snyan pa mi zer zhing mi smod pa snyan par smra zhing legs par bshad pa mthun par 'dzin pas seng ge'i ro stod lta bu dang phrag pa'i lhun mdzes par grub pa ste /
analyzed: mi snyan pa mi zer zhing mi smod pa snyan par smra zhing legs par bshad pa mthun par 'dzin pas seng ge'i ro stod lta bu dang phrag pa'i lhun mdzes par grub pa ste /

analyzed: de ni thub pa med pa'i snga ltas so //
translated: This is a sign of his invincibility.

original: na ba rnams la rtsis dang rim gro dang sman dang nyams su phan pa'i zas byin pa dang / rim gror byas pas phrag so shin tu rgyas pa dang / ro bro ba'i mchog ste /
analyzed: na ba rnams la rtsis dang rim gro dang sman dang nyams su phan pa'i zas byin pa dang / rim gror byas pas phrag so shin tu rgyas pa dang / ro bro ba'i mchog ste /

analyzed: de ni nad nyung ba'i snga ltas so //
translated: This is a sign of having little illness.

translated: By first engaging in activities such as making parks, retinues, drinks, ponds, difficult passages, food, garlands, resting places, and temples, and by giving to others, one obtains the two signs of having the size and breadth of a nyagrodha tree and

analyzed: dbu spyi gtsug dang ldan pa ste /

translated: This is a sign of having great power.

analyzed: de ni tshigs kun gyis snyan pa'i snga ltas so //

analyzed: de ni 'khor snga nas bsags pa'i snga ltas so //

translated: This is a sign of the assembly that cannot be divided.üîΩBecause of looking with eyes that are free from desire, anger, and ignorance, as if embracing with one‚Äôs arms, without thinking of faults,

analyzed: rab 'byor de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis so //

analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eighty minor marks of a tathƒÅgata?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mngon par 'du bya ba thams cad las dben pa ste /

analyzed: sen mo zangs kyi mdog ltar 'dug pa yin /

analyzed: sen mo mtho ba yin /

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni tshul kha na ma thob mi mnga' ba ste /

analyzed: sor mo zlum pa yin /

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu tshogs pa ste /

analyzed: sor mo rgyas pa yin /

translated: Their ankles do not protrude.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mi mnyam pa thams cad las sgrol ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mi mnyam pa thams cad las sgrol ba ste /
translated: The Lord Buddhas are the liberators from all unevenness.

original: zhabs mi mnyam pa med pa yin /
analyzed: zhabs mi mnyam pa med pa yin /
translated: Their feet are even.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mi'i seng ge ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mi'i seng ge ste /
translated: The Lord Buddhas are the lions of men.

original: seng ge'i 'gros su bzhud pa yin /
analyzed: seng ge'i 'gros su bzhud pa yin /
translated: They walk with the gait of a lion.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mi'i glang po ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mi'i glang po ste /
translated: The Lord Buddhas are the elephants of men.

original: glang po'i 'gros su bzhud pa yin /
analyzed: glang po'i 'gros su bzhud pa yin /
translated: They walk with the gait of an elephant.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni ngang pa'i rgyal po ltar nam mkha' la bzhud pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni ngang pa'i rgyal po ltar nam mkha' la bzhud pa ste /
translated: The Lord Buddhas are like the king of geese. They walk through the sky.

original: ngang pa'i stabs su bzhud pa yin /
analyzed: ngang pa'i stabs su bzhud pa yin /
translated: They walk with the gait of a goose.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mi'i khyu mchog ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mi'i khyu mchog ste /
translated: The Lord Buddhas are the bulls of men.

original: khyu mchog gi stabs su bzhud pa yin /
analyzed: khyu mchog gi stabs su bzhud pa yin /
translated: They walk with the gait of a bull.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mthun pa'i lam mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mthun pa'i lam mnga' ba ste /
translated: The Lord Buddhas have the path of harmony.

original: g-yas phyogs su bzhud pa @244b yin ;
analyzed: g-yas phyogs su bzhud pa @244b yin ;
translated: They walk with a rightward spiral.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni blta na mdzes pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni blta na mdzes pa ste /
translated: The Lord Buddhas are beautiful to behold.

original: mdzes par bzhud pa yin /
analyzed: mdzes par bzhud pa yin /
translated: They walk beautifully.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu thugs yon po mi mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu thugs yon po mi mnga' ba ste /
translated: The Lord Buddhas are always without crookedness of mind.

original: ma yo bar bzhud pa yin /
analyzed: ma yo bar bzhud pa yin /
translated: They walk without wavering.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni tshul rnam par dag pa'i yon tan ston pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni tshul rnam par dag pa'i yon tan ston pa ste /
translated: The Lord Buddhas teach the qualities of pure morality.

original: sku shin tu legs pa yin /
analyzed: sku shin tu legs pa yin /
translated: They have a very well-proportioned body.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sdig pa'i chos thams cad shin tu sbyangs pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sdig pa'i chos thams cad shin tu sbyangs pa ste /
translated: The Lord Buddhas have completely purified all evil dharmas.

original: sku shin tu sbyangs pa yin /
analyzed: sku shin tu sbyangs pa yin /
translated: They have a very purified body.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos rim gyis ston pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos rim gyis ston pa ste /
translated: The Lord Buddhas teach the Dharma in stages.

original: sku rim gyis gzhol ba yin /
analyzed: sku rim gyis gzhol ba yin /
translated: They have a body that slopes gradually.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sku dang gsung dang thugs gtsang ma dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sku dang gsung dang thugs gtsang ma dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The Lord Buddhas have a pure body, speech, and mind.

original: sku shin tu gtsang ba yin /
analyzed: sku shin tu gtsang ba yin /
translated: They have a very pure body.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rang bzhin gyis 'jam pa'i thugs dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rang bzhin gyis 'jam pa'i thugs dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The Lord Buddhas have a mind that is naturally gentle.

original: sku shin tu 'jam pa yin /
analyzed: sku shin tu 'jam pa yin /
translated: Their bodies are extremely smooth.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i thugs mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i thugs mnga' ba ste /
translated: The Bhagavat Buddhas have a nature of a very pure mind.

original: sku shin tu rnam par dag pa yin /
analyzed: sku shin tu rnam par dag pa yin /
translated: Their bodies are extremely pure.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos dang 'dul ba shin tu rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos dang 'dul ba shin tu rdzogs pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavat Buddhas have a very complete Dharma and Vinaya.

original: dpe byad shin tu rdzogs pa yin /
analyzed: dpe byad shin tu rdzogs pa yin /
translated: Their bodily marks are very complete.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni yon tan shin tu yangs shing bzang po ston pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni yon tan shin tu yangs shing bzang po ston pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavat Buddhas show very extensive and good qualities.

original: sku che shing mdzes pa yin /
analyzed: sku che shing mdzes pa yin /
translated: Their bodies are large and beautiful.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sems can thams cad la mnyam pa'i thugs mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sems can thams cad la mnyam pa'i thugs mnga' ba ste /
translated: The Bhagavat Buddhas have a mind that is equal to all sentient beings.

original: sku legs par mnyam pa yin /
analyzed: sku legs par mnyam pa yin /
translated: Their bodies are very even.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni shin tu 'jam pa'i chos ston pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni shin tu 'jam pa'i chos ston pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavat Buddhas teach a very smooth Dharma.

original: sku shin tu gzhon pa yin /
analyzed: sku shin tu gzhon pa yin /
translated: Their bodies are very youthful.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu zhum pa med pa'i thugs mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu zhum pa med pa'i thugs mnga' ba ste /
translated: The Bhagavat Buddhas always have a mind that is not depressed.

original: sku zhum pa med pa yin /
analyzed: sku zhum pa med pa yin /
translated: Their bodies are not depressed.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad byang ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad byang ba ste /
translated: The Lord Buddhas have purified all roots of nonvirtue.

original: sku shin tu rgyas pa yin /
analyzed: sku shin tu rgyas pa yin /
translated: Their bodies are very full.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni yang 'byung ba shin tu bcom zhing zad pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni yang 'byung ba shin tu bcom zhing zad pa ste /
translated: The Lord Buddhas have destroyed and exhausted all future rebirth.

original: sku shin tu mkhregs pa yin /
analyzed: sku shin tu mkhregs pa yin /
translated: Their bodies are very firm.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag dang nying lag legs par ston pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag dang nying lag legs par ston pa ste /
translated: The Lord Buddhas have well demonstrated the major and minor parts of dependent origination.
